TEXT.English: The Haruspex are calling for a sacrifice of the unfaithful in %s2_city to appease Mother.
TEXT.French: Les Haruspex appellent au sacifice des païens dans la ville de %s2_city pour apaiser la Mère.
TEXT.German: Die Haruspex rufen zur Beruhigung von Mutter nach einem Opfer der Untreuen in %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: The Haruspex are calling for a sacrifice of the unfaithful in %s2_city to appease Mother.
TEXT.Spanish: The Haruspex are calling for a sacrifice of the unfaithful in %s2_city to appease Mother.

TEXT.English: "As Mother wishes..."
TEXT.French: "Si telle est la volonté de la Mère..."
TEXT.German: "Wie Mutter wünscht..."
TEXT.Italian: "As Mother wishes..."
TEXT.Spanish: "As Mother wishes..."

TEXT.English: Mother wants something. She wants it now. Secure for her the %s7_resource that lies within %s1_civ_adjective borders. Obtain the resource elsewhere if you wish, but what she requires is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] she has chosen. A suitable award will be found if you succeed. The Haruspex already have a punishment selected if you fail Mother.
TEXT.French: La Mère veut quelque chose. Elle le veut maintenant. Sécurisez pour elle le/la/les %s7_resource qui se trouve(nt) dans les frontières %s1_civ_adjective. Obtenez cette ressource ailleurs si vous le souhaitez, mais ce qu'elle veut c'est ce/cette/ces [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] qu'elle a choisi. Une récompense substancielle vous attend si vous réussissez. Les Haruspex ont déjà choisi votre punition si vous décevez la Mère.
TEXT.German: Mutter möchte etwas. Und sie will es jetzt. Sichere für sie %s7_resource innerhalb der %s1_civ_adjective Grenzen. Hol dir die Ressource wo immer du willst, aber besorg ihr [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT]. Eine passende Anerkennung wird sich bei Erfolg finden. Die Haruspex haben sich allerdings bereits für eine Strafe entschieden, für den Fall deines Scheiterns.
TEXT.Italian: Mother wants something. She wants it now. Secure for her the %s7_resource that lies within %s1_civ_adjective borders. Obtain the resource elsewhere if you wish, but what she requires is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] she has chosen. A suitable award will be found if you succeed. The Haruspex already have a punishment selected if you fail Mother.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother wants something. She wants it now. Secure for her the %s7_resource that lies within %s1_civ_adjective borders. Obtain the resource elsewhere if you wish, but what she requires is the [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] she has chosen. A suitable award will be found if you succeed. The Haruspex already have a punishment selected if you fail Mother.

TEXT.English: Mother Wants[PARAGRAPH:1]What Mother Wants mother gets.
TEXT.French: La Mère veut ceci.[PARAGRAPH:1]Et ce que la Mère veut, elle l'obtient.
TEXT.German: Mutter Wünscht[PARAGRAPH:1]Was Mutter will, bekommt Mutter auch.
TEXT.Italian: Mother Wants[PARAGRAPH:1]What Mother Wants mother gets.
TEXT.Spanish: Mother Wants[PARAGRAPH:1]What Mother Wants mother gets.

TEXT.English: [PARAGRAPH:1]Mother wants it, and you must invade %s1_civ and gain control of the %s2_resource resource or face her displeasure.[PARAGRAPH:1]You have no more than %d3 turns, and probably significantly fewer, before you exceed Mother's patience. Do not fail Mother.
TEXT.French: [PARAGRAPH:1]La Mère veut ceci. Envahissez les %s1_civ et prenez le contrôle de la ressource %s2_resource ou affrontez Son courroux.[PARAGRAPH:1]Votre délai est de %d3 tours maximum, et il faudra vraisemblablement beaucoup moins de temps avant que la Mère ne s'impatiente. Ne La décevez pas.
TEXT.German: [PARAGRAPH:1]Mutter will es, und daher mußt du die %s1_civ angreifen und dir Kontrolle über die %s2_resource Ressource verschaffen oder ihren Unmut ins Auge sehen.[PARAGRAPH:1]Du hast höchstens %d3 Runden Zeit, und vielleicht sogar noch weniger, bevor Mutters Geduld erschöpft ist. Mutter enttäuscht man nicht.
TEXT.Italian: [PARAGRAPH:1]Mother wants it, and you must invade %s1_civ and gain control of the %s2_resource resource or face her displeasure.[PARAGRAPH:1]You have no more than %d3 turns, and probably significantly fewer, before you exceed Mother's patience. Do not fail Mother.
TEXT.Spanish: [PARAGRAPH:1]Mother wants it, and you must invade %s1_civ and gain control of the %s2_resource resource or face her displeasure.[PARAGRAPH:1]You have no more than %d3 turns, and probably significantly fewer, before you exceed Mother's patience. Do not fail Mother.

TEXT.English: You have managed to wrest control of %s1_civ_adjective [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] resource in an acceptable amount of time. Mother is satisfied. For now.
TEXT.French: Vous vous êtes adjugé le contrôle du/de la [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] %s1_civ_adjective dans un délai acceptable. La Mère est satisfaite. Pour l'instant...
TEXT.German: Du hast erfolgreich Kontrolle über %s1_civ_adjective [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] Ressouce erlangt, und das auch in einem akzeptabelen Zeitraum. Mutter ist zufrieden. Im Moment.
TEXT.Italian: You have managed to wrest control of %s1_civ_adjective [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] resource in an acceptable amount of time. Mother is satisfied. For now.
TEXT.Spanish: You have managed to wrest control of %s1_civ_adjective [COLOR_HIGHLIGHT_TEXT]%s9_resource[COLOR_REVERT] resource in an acceptable amount of time. Mother is satisfied. For now.

TEXT.English: Obey Mother's commands as spoken by the Haruspex. Carry the darkness of the caves to our enemies and, until that darkness reclaims you, appreciate your reward.
TEXT.French: Obéissez aux commandements de la Mère tels que les Haruspex vous les ont transmis. Propagez l'ombre des caves jusqu'à nos ennemis, et, jusqu'à ce que l'ombre vous réclame, appréciez votre récompense.
TEXT.German: Höre Mutters Befehle, verkündet durch die Haruspex. Bring unseren Feinden die Dunkelheit unserer Höhlen und beanspruche, wenn die Dunkelheit nicht dich beansprucht, deine Belohnung.
TEXT.Italian: Obey Mother's commands as spoken by the Haruspex. Carry the darkness of the caves to our enemies and, until that darkness reclaims you, appreciate your reward.
TEXT.Spanish: Obey Mother's commands as spoken by the Haruspex. Carry the darkness of the caves to our enemies and, until that darkness reclaims you, appreciate your reward.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Receive %d1 [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] [NUM1:unit:units] with %d3 experience points.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Recevoir %d1 [NUM1:unité:unités] [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] avec %d3 points d'expérience.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Erhalte %d1 [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] [NUM1:unit:units] mit %d3 Erfahrungspunkten.
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Receive %d1 [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] [NUM1:unit:units] with %d3 experience points.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Receive %d1 [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s2_unit[COLOR_REVERT] [NUM1:unit:units] with %d3 experience points.

TEXT.English: The Archos, supposedly at the whim of their monstrous Mother, have attacked the %s4:2_civ_adjective and seized certain resources.
TEXT.French: Les Archos, à priori pour satisfaire l'appétit de leur monstrueuse Mère, ont attaqué les %s4:2_civ_adjective et pris le contrôle de certaines ressources.
TEXT.German: Die Archos haben, höchstwahrscheinlich auf Weisung ihrer monströsen Mutter %s4:2_civ_adjective Lande angegriffen und einige Ressourcen erbeutet.
TEXT.Italian: The Archos, supposedly at the whim of their monstrous Mother, have attacked the %s4:2_civ_adjective and seized certain resources.
TEXT.Spanish: The Archos, supposedly at the whim of their monstrous Mother, have attacked the %s4:2_civ_adjective and seized certain resources.

TEXT.English: Whispers carried on the cave's breath carry the word. Your secrecy is futile, she knows. She always knows. You have failed and our people suffer Mother's anger.
TEXT.French: Les murmures portés par le souffle de la grotte transmettent les paroles. Vos secrets sont futiles, Elle sait. Elle sait toujours. Vous avez échoué et notre peuple subit la colère de la Mère.
TEXT.German: Flüstern verbreitet das Gerücht in der atmenden Höhle. Deine Zurückgezogenheit ist unnötig, sie weiß es. Sie weiß Bescheid. Sie weiß immer Bescheid. Du hast versagt und unser Volk leidet unter Mutters Zorn.
TEXT.Italian: Whispers carried on the cave's breath carry the word. Your secrecy is futile, she knows. She always knows. You have failed and our people suffer Mother's anger.
TEXT.Spanish: Whispers carried on the cave's breath carry the word. Your secrecy is futile, she knows. She always knows. You have failed and our people suffer Mother's anger.

TEXT.English: It is time for the Festival of Winds - inform the people
TEXT.French: Il est temps d'organiser le Festival des Vents ! Informez le peuple.
TEXT.German: Die Zeit für das Festival der Winde ist gekommen - informiert das Volk.
TEXT.Italian: It is time for the Festival of Winds - inform the people
TEXT.Spanish: It is time for the Festival of Winds - inform the people

TEXT.English: Tell the workers not to fear. They are of Mother's brood.
TEXT.French: Dites aux mineurs de ne pas avoir peur. Elles font partie de la couvée de la Mère.
TEXT.German: Sagt den Arbeitern, sie sollen sich nicht fürchten. Sie sind aus Mutters Brut.
TEXT.Italian: Tell the workers not to fear. They are of Mother's brood.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell the workers not to fear. They are of Mother's brood.

TEXT.English: Your unit wakes from dreams of blood. Aeron, the God of Hate, has chosen your assassin to be his advocate in Erebus.
TEXT.French: Votre unité s'éveille de rêves sanguinolents. Aeron, Dieu de la Haine, a choisi votre assassin comme son représentant en Erebus.
TEXT.German: Deine Einheit erwacht aus Träumen voller Blutes. Aeron, der Gott des Hasses, hat deinen Meuchelmörder auserwählt, sein Vertreter auf Erebus zu sein.
TEXT.Italian: Your unit wakes from dreams of blood. Aeron, the God of Hate, has chosen your assassin to be his advocate in Erebus.
TEXT.Spanish: Your unit wakes from dreams of blood. Aeron, the God of Hate, has chosen your assassin to be his advocate in Erebus.

TEXT.English: An affluent duke in the city of %s2_city has passed away. He has bequeathed his fortune to the government. What would you like done with it?
TEXT.French: Un riche duc de la ville de %s2_city est décédé. Il a légué sa fortune au gouvernement. Que comptez-vous en faire ?
TEXT.German: Ein wohlhabender Graf ist in der Stadt %s2_city verstorben. Er hat sein Vermögen der Regierung vermacht. Was soll damit geschehen?
TEXT.Italian: An affluent duke in the city of %s2_city has passed away. He has bequeathed his fortune to the government. What would you like done with it?
TEXT.Spanish: Un opulento duque en la ciudad de %s2_city ha pasado a la historia. Éste ha legado su fortuna al gobierno. ¿Qué queréis que hagamos con él?

TEXT.English: He was a great man, construct a monument in his honor.
TEXT.French: C'était un grand homme. Érigez un monument en son honneur.
TEXT.German: Er war ein großer Mann. Lasst ihm zu Ehren ein Denkmal errichten.
TEXT.Italian: He was a great man, construct a monument in his honor.
TEXT.Spanish: Fue un gran hombre, construid un monumento en su honor.

TEXT.English: Give his money to the poor, I'm sure it's what he would have wanted.
TEXT.French: Distribuez sa fortune aux pauvres. Je suis sûr que c'est ce qu'il aurait voulu.
TEXT.German: Gebt sein Gold den Armen. Ich bin mir sicher, dass er das gewollt hätte.
TEXT.Italian: Give his money to the poor, I'm sure it's what he would have wanted.
TEXT.Spanish: Dad su dinero a los pobres, estoy seguro/a de que es lo que él hubiera querido.

TEXT.English: Who am I to question his wishes? Have his finances added to our treasury.
TEXT.French: Qui suis-je pour contester ses choix ? Adjoignez ses possessions au Trésor Public.
TEXT.German: Wer bin ich, dass ich seinen letzen Wunsch anzweifle? Bringt das Gold in die Schatzkammer.
TEXT.Italian: Who am I to question his wishes? Have his finances added to our treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: ¿Quién soy yo para cuestionar sus deseos? Añadid su fortuna a nuestro tesoro.

TEXT.English: A traveling alchemist has offered to sell a Healing Salve to your unit.
TEXT.French: Un alchimiste itinérant a proposé de vendre à votre unité un baume de soins.
TEXT.German: Ein reisender Alchemist hat Eurer Einheit eine Heilsalbe zum Kauf angeboten
TEXT.Italian: A traveling alchemist has offered to sell a Healing Salve to your unit.
TEXT.Spanish: Un viajero Alquimista ha ofrecido vender un Bálsamo de Curación a vuestra unidad.

TEXT.English: No, we can't afford it.
TEXT.French: Non, nous ne pouvons nous le permettre.
TEXT.German: Nein, wir können uns das nicht leisten.
TEXT.Italian: No, we can't afford it.
TEXT.Spanish: No, no nos lo podemos permitir.

TEXT.English: Yes, the salve will be useful in future wars.
TEXT.French: Oui, le baume sera utile dans nos guerres futures.
TEXT.German: Ja, die Salbe wird in zukünftigen Kriegen nützlich sein.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, the salve will be useful in future wars.
TEXT.Spanish: Sí, el bálsamo será útil en futuras guerras.

TEXT.English: Hire the alchemist to build an Alchemy Lab in one of our cities.
TEXT.French: Engagez l'Alchimiste pour construire un laboratoire d'Alchimie dans une de nos villes.
TEXT.German: Heuert den Alchemisten an, um ein Alchemielabor in einer unserer Städte zu errichten.
TEXT.Italian: Hire the alchemist to build an Alchemy Lab in one of our cities.
TEXT.Spanish: Contratad al Alquimista para construir un Laboratorio de Alquimia en una de nuestras ciudades.

TEXT.English: Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_building[COLOR_REVERT] in %s2_city
TEXT.French: Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_building[COLOR_REVERT] in %s2_city
TEXT.German: Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_building[COLOR_REVERT] in %s2_city
TEXT.Italian: Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_building[COLOR_REVERT] in %s2_city
TEXT.Spanish: Build [COLOR_UNIT_TEXT]%s1_building[COLOR_REVERT] in %s2_city

TEXT.English: The Amurites have invited your unit to their capital to attend the magical trials.
TEXT.French: Les Amurites ont invité votre unité dans leur capitale pour assister aux épreuves magiques.
TEXT.German: Die Amuriten haben Eure Einheit in ihre Hauptstadt eingeladen, um an den magischen Prüfungen teilzunehmen.
TEXT.Italian: The Amurites have invited your unit to their capital to attend the magical trials.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Amurites han invitado a vuestra unidad a ir a su capital para asistir a las pruebas mágicas.

TEXT.English: Send him, if he passes the trials it could be a valuable experience.
TEXT.French: Envoyez-le. Remporter ces épreuves pourrait lui procurer une expérience considérable.
TEXT.German: Auf, auf! Die erfolgreiche Absolvierung dieser Prüfungen könnte eine wertvolle Erfahrung sein.
TEXT.Italian: Send him, if he passes the trials it could be a valuable experience.
TEXT.Spanish: Enviadlo, si pasa las pruebas sería una experiencia importante.

TEXT.English: We cannot afford the distraction.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons nous permettre cette distraction.
TEXT.German: Wir können uns diese Ablenkung nicht leisten.
TEXT.Italian: We cannot afford the distraction.
TEXT.Spanish: No podemos permitirnos esta distracción.

TEXT.English: Our scholars report that %s2_city sits atop the remains of an ancient Patrian city. They want us to abandon a section of the city so they search for artifacts from the Age of Magic. The research will be valuable, but many people will be made homeless by the excavation.
TEXT.French: Nos érudits rapportent que %s2_city est construite sur les ruines d'une ancienne ville patrienne. Ils souhaitent que nous abandonnions un quartier de la ville pour leur permettre de fouiller à la recherche d'artefacts datant de l'Âge de la Magie. Les recherches auront une grande valeur, mais de nombreux citoyens devront être expulsés.
TEXT.German: Unsere Gelehrten berichten, dass die Stadt %s2_city auf den Überresten einer alten patrianischen Stadt errichtet wurde. Sie wollen, dass wir einen Teil der Stadt abreißen, damit sie nach Artefakten aus dem Zeitalter der Magie suchen können. Die Untersuchung wird nützlich sein, aber viele Bürger werden durch die Ausgrabung ihr Obdach verlieren.
TEXT.Italian: Our scholars report that %s2_city sits atop the remains of an ancient Patrian city. They want us to abandon a section of the city so they search for artifacts from the Age of Magic. The research will be valuable, but many people will be made homeless by the excavation.
TEXT.Spanish: Our scholars report that %s2_city sits atop the remains of an ancient Patrian city. They want us to abandon a section of the city so they search for artifacts from the Age of Magic. The research will be valuable, but many people will be made homeless by the excavation.

TEXT.English: Pursuit of knowledge is a noble goal, seize the land and give it to the researchers.
TEXT.French: L'obtention de connaissances est un but noble. Réquisitionnez les terres et donnez-les aux chercheurs.
TEXT.German: Das Streben nach Wissen ist ein edles Ziel. Räumt das Gebiet und übergebt es den Gelehrten.
TEXT.Italian: Pursuit of knowledge is a noble goal, seize the land and give it to the researchers.
TEXT.Spanish: Pursuit of knowledge is a noble goal, seize the land and give it to the researchers.

TEXT.English: Let what lies beneath the city stay buried.
TEXT.French: Laissez ce qui gît sous la ville rester enterré.
TEXT.German: Lasst das, was sich unter der Stadt befindet, dort begraben.
TEXT.Italian: Let what lies beneath the city stay buried.
TEXT.Spanish: Let what lies beneath the city stay buried.

TEXT.English: On a moonless night a procession of angels passes through your lands. They are beautiful and even the most troubled souls are comforted by their passing.
TEXT.French: Lors d'une nuit sans lune, une procession d'anges traverse vos terres. Ils sont magnifiques et même les âmes les plus troublées sont réconfortées à leur passage.
TEXT.German: In einer mondlosen Nacht zieht eine feierliche Prozession von Engeln durch Euer Land. Sie sind wunderschön und sogar die sorgenvollsten Seelen finden Trost in ihrem Anblick.
TEXT.Italian: On a moonless night a procession of angels passes through your lands. They are beautiful and even the most troubled souls are comforted by their passing.
TEXT.Spanish: On a moonless night a procession of angels passes through your lands. They are beautiful and even the most troubled souls are comforted by their passing.

TEXT.English: This can only help bring peace to the world.
TEXT.French: Ça ne peux qu'aider à instaurer la paix mondiale.
TEXT.German: Dies kann dem Frieden in der Welt nur zuträglich sein.
TEXT.Italian: This can only help bring peace to the world.
TEXT.Spanish: This can only help bring peace to the world.

TEXT.English: Mark the land they passed through as holy.
TEXT.French: Déclarez saints les territoires qu'ils ont traversés.
TEXT.German: Kennzeichnet das Land, durch das sie schritten, als heilig.
TEXT.Italian: Mark the land they passed through as holy.
TEXT.Spanish: Mark the land they passed through as holy.

TEXT.English: Sallos, Duke of the 8th layer of Hell, offers you the service of his daughter, the beautiful Kalra. Her reason is frequently overcome by her bloodlust and Sallos hopes that time spent on creation will increase her discipline.
TEXT.French: Sallos, Duc du huitième cercle de l'Enfer, vous offre les services de sa fille, la belle Kalra. Sa raison est souvent submergée par sa soif de sang et Sallos espère que le temps passé sur Création lui apprendra la discipline.
TEXT.German: Sallos, Herzog der 8. Ebene der Hölle, bietet Euch die Dienste seiner Tochter, der wunderschönen Kalra, an. Ihr Verstand lässt sich oft von ihrer Blutlust überstimmen und Sallos hofft, dass ein kleiner Aufenthalt in der Schöpfung ihre Disziplin verbessern wird.
TEXT.Italian: Sallos, Duke of the 8th layer of Hell, offers you the service of his daughter, the beautiful Kalra. Her reason is frequently overcome by her bloodlust and Sallos hopes that time spent on creation will increase her discipline.
TEXT.Spanish: Sallos, Duque del 8º estrato del Infierno, os ofrece los servicios de su hija, la hermosa Kalra. Su razón es frecuentemente sobrepasada por su sed de sangre y Sallos espera que el tiempo que ella pase en la creación le enseñe disciplina.

TEXT.English: I will personally ensure that she receives the attention she requires.
TEXT.French: Je m'assurerai personnellement qu'elle reçoive toute l'attention dont elle a besoin.
TEXT.German: Ich werde persönlich dafür sorgen, dass sie die Aufmerksamkeit bekommt, die sie verdient.
TEXT.Italian: I will personally ensure that she receives the attention she requires.
TEXT.Spanish: Me ocuparé personalmente de que reciba la atención adecuada.

TEXT.English: An Azer has been spotted in our lands. It will burn and destroy any land it passes over until we kill it.
TEXT.French: Un Azer a été repéré sur vos terres. Il brûlera et détruira tout sur son passage jusqu'à ce que nous l'ayons détruit.
TEXT.German: Ein Azer wurde in Euren Ländereien gesichtet. Er wird alles in seinem Weg verbrennen und zerstören, wenn er nicht schnell vernichtet wird.
TEXT.Italian: An Azer has been spotted in our lands. It will burn and destroy any land it passes over until we kill it.
TEXT.Spanish: Un Azer ha sido avistado en nuestras tierras. Quemará y destruirá cualquier terreno sobre el que pase hasta que lo matemos.

TEXT.English: A traveling Balseraph carnival has arrived in %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Un carnaval itinérant balseraphin est arrivé à %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Ein reisender Jahrmarkt der Balseraph hat sich in der Stadt %s2_city eingefunden.
TEXT.Italian: A traveling Balseraph carnival has arrived in %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Ha llegado un carnaval viajero Balseraph en %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Double the guards on the treasury and make sure they are searched before they leave.
TEXT.French: Doublez les gardes du trésor et faites-en sorte que les artistes soient fouillés avant leur départ.
TEXT.German: Verdoppelt die Wachen vor der Schatzkammer und stellt sicher, dass sie vor Verlassen der Stadt gründlich durchsucht werden.
TEXT.Italian: Double the guards on the treasury and make sure they are searched before they leave.
TEXT.Spanish: Doblad la guardia en la tesorería y aseguraos de que sean registrados antes de que se vayan.

TEXT.English: Make sure the performers receive a gift in line with their talent.
TEXT.French: Aussurez-vous qu'ils obtiennent un présent à la hauteur de leur talent.
TEXT.German: Stellt sicher, dass die Akrobaten ein Geschenk erhalten, welches ihrem Können entspricht.
TEXT.Italian: Make sure the performers receive a gift in line with their talent.
TEXT.Spanish: Aseguraos de que los actores reciben un regalo acorde a su talento.

TEXT.English: Request that they permanently join the city.
TEXT.French: Demandez leur de rejoindre la ville de manière permanente.
TEXT.German: Ersucht sie, sich dauerhaft in der Stadt niederzulassen.
TEXT.Italian: Request that they permanently join the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Pedidles que se unan de forma permanente a la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Request that they add their talents to the local carnival.
TEXT.French: Demandez leur de se joindre au carnaval de la ville.
TEXT.German: Ersucht ihre jungen Talente, sich dem örtlichen Jahrmarkt anzuschließen.
TEXT.Italian: Request that they add their talents to the local carnival.
TEXT.Spanish: Pedidles que sumen sus talentos con en carnaval local.

TEXT.English: The soldiers of %s2_city have captured the Bandit Lord Nietz! He has plagued our land for years and is charged with about every crime we have a law for. Our people await you to finally deliver justice.
TEXT.French: Les soldats de %s2_city ont capturé Nietz le seigneur bandit ! Cela fait des années qu'il dévaste nos terres et est accusé d'à peu près tous les crimes pour lesquels nous avons des lois. Vos citoyens attendent que justice soit enfin faite.
TEXT.German: Der Banditenkönig Nietz wurde von den Soldaten der Stadt %s2_city gefangen genommen! Er hat unser Reich jahrelang geplündert und dabei jedes Verbrechen begangen, für das wir ein Gesetz haben. Unser Volk erwartet, dass Ihr ihn hart bestraft.
TEXT.Italian: The soldiers of %s2_city have captured the Bandit Lord Nietz! He has plagued our land for years and is charged with about every crime we have a law for. Our people await you to finally deliver justice.
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Los soldados de %s2_city han capturado al Bandido Lord Nietz! Ha plagado nuestras tierras durante años y tiene cargos de cada crimen que existe en nuestras leyes. Nuestro pueblo os espera para finalmente aportar justicia.

TEXT.English: By all means, see that he is hung in the public square.
TEXT.French: Quoi qu'il arrive, veillez à ce qu'il soit pendu en place publique.
TEXT.German: Sorgt dafür, dass er vor aller Öffentlichkeit gehängt wird.
TEXT.Italian: By all means, see that he is hung in the public square.
TEXT.Spanish: Por todos los medios necesarios, que sea colgado en la plaza pública.

TEXT.English: Set up for an elaborate execution. The people will have their justice and all others will know the penalty for breaking our laws.
TEXT.French: Préparez minutieusement son exécution. Le citoyens honnêtes auront leur vengeance et les autres sauront ce qu'il en coûte de transgresser nos lois.
TEXT.German: Bereitet alles für eine aufwendige Hinrichtung vor. Das Volk wird seine Gerechtigkeit bekommen und allen anderen wird die Strafe für das Brechen unserer Gesetze vor Augen geführt.
TEXT.Italian: Set up for an elaborate execution. The people will have their justice and all others will know the penalty for breaking our laws.
TEXT.Spanish: Preparad una ejecución elaborada. El pueblo tendrá su justicia y todos los demás conocerán la pena por quebrantar nuestras leyes.

TEXT.English: This Nietz sounds like a man of rare skill, certainly there are better uses for him than death...
TEXT.French: Ce Nietz semble doué de talents précieux, et nous pourrions certainement lui trouver un meilleur usage que le tuer...
TEXT.German: Dieser Nietz scheint ein Mann mit ungewöhnlichen Talenten zu sein. Sicherlich gibt es bessere Verwendungsmöglichkeiten für ihn als den Tod...
TEXT.Italian: This Nietz sounds like a man of rare skill, certainly there are better uses for him than death...
TEXT.Spanish: Este Nietz parece un hombre con habilidades raras, ciertamente hay mejores usos para él que la muerte

TEXT.English: Gain Nietz, a Horseman unit with the Mobility I and Hero promotions
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Obtenir Nietz, un cavalier doté des promotions [LINK=PROMOTION_HERO]Héros[\LINK] et [LINK=PROMOTION_MOBILITY1]Mobilité I[\LINK]
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]Nietz tritt in Eure Dienste, eine berittene Einheit mit den Beförderungen "Fortbewegung I" und "Held"
TEXT.Italian: Gain Nietz, a Horseman unit with the Mobility I and Hero promotions
TEXT.Spanish: Gana a Nietz, una unidad Jinete con ascensos de Mobilidad I y Héroe

TEXT.English: A few weeks ago an inventor named Bareke from %s2_city was kidnapped by a bandit band led by a half-witted ogre. Bareke's family paid the ransom and got a letter back from Bareke stating that he was enjoying the bandits' company and had found something in their lair that he was investigating. Since then the bandits have been stealing unusual items from passing caravans, tackle, ropes, pickled herring, etc. The family asks you to send in soldiers to recover Bareke.
TEXT.French: Il y a quelques semaines, un inventeur du nom de Bareke de la ville de %s2_city a été enlevé par une troupe de bandits conduite par un ogre stupide. La famille de Bareke a versé la rançon et a reçu une lettre de Bareke déclarant qu'il commençait à apprécier la compagnie des bandits et qu'il avait découvert dans leur repaire quelque chose à étudier. Depuis lors les bandits ont commencé à voler des objets inhabituels des caravanes de passage : des poulies, des cordes, des harengs marinés, etc. La famille vous demande d'envoyer des soldats pour récupérer Bareke.
TEXT.German: Vor einigen Wochen wurde ein Erfinder namens Bareke von einer Banditenbande, die von einem schwachsinnigen Troll angeführt wird, aus der Stadt %s2_city entführt. Barekes Familie bezahlte das Lösegeld und erhielt einen Brief von Bareke zurück, in dem er schrieb, dass er die Gesellschaft der Bande genieße und dass er etwas in deren Versteck gefunden hätte, das er derzeit untersuche. Seitdem haben die Banditen ungewöhnliche Dinge von vorbeiziehenden Karawanen gestohlen: Flaschenzüge, Seile, Salzheringe und anderes. Die Familie bittet Euch, Soldaten zu entsenden, um Bareke zurückzuholen.
TEXT.Italian: A few weeks ago an inventor named Bareke from %s2_city was kidnapped by a bandit band led by a half-witted ogre. Bareke's family paid the ransom and got a letter back from Bareke stating that he was enjoying the bandits' company and had found something in their lair that he was investigating. Since then the bandits have been stealing unusual items from passing caravans, tackle, ropes, pickled herring, etc. The family asks you to send in soldiers to recover Bareke.
TEXT.Spanish: A few weeks ago an inventor named Bareke from %s2_city was kidnapped by a bandit band led by a half-witted ogre. Bareke's family paid the ransom and got a letter back from Bareke stating that he was enjoying the bandits' company and had found something in their lair that he was investigating. Since then the bandits have been stealing unusual items from passing caravans, tackle, ropes, pickled herring, etc. The family asks you to send in soldiers to recover Bareke.

TEXT.English: I won't waste the army's time with this.
TEXT.French: Je ne ferai pas perdre son temps à mon armée avec tout ça.
TEXT.German: Ich werde die Zeit meiner Armee nicht damit verschwenden.
TEXT.Italian: I won't waste the army's time with this.
TEXT.Spanish: I won't waste the army's time with this.

TEXT.English: Order the guards to find Bareke and drag him out of the wilderness.
TEXT.French: Dites aux gardes de trouver Bareke et de l'extirper de ses contrées sauvages.
TEXT.German: Befehlt den Wachen, Bareke zu finden und ihn aus der Wildnis zu zerren.
TEXT.Italian: Order the guards to find Bareke and drag him out of the wilderness.
TEXT.Spanish: Order the guards to find Bareke and drag him out of the wilderness.

TEXT.English: Is that why there wasn't any pickled herring at last night's dinner? Send in some soldiers and recover the herring right away!
TEXT.French: C'est donc pour ça qu'il n'y avait aucun hareng fumé au diner d'hier soir ? Envoyez tout de suite des soldats récupérer les harengs !
TEXT.German: Gab es deshalb beim letzten Abendessen keine Salzheringe? Schickt einige Soldaten und holt die Heringe sofort zurück!
TEXT.Italian: Is that why there wasn't any pickled herring at last night's dinner? Send in some soldiers and recover the herring right away!
TEXT.Spanish: Is that why there wasn't any pickled herring at last night's dinner? Send in some soldiers and recover the herring right away!

TEXT.English: Refugees from the Calabim lands seek sanctuary in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Des réfugiés des terres calabionnes demandent l'asile dans la ville de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Flüchtlinge aus dem Reich der Calabim ersuchen um Schutz in der Stadt %s2_city.
TEXT.Italian: Refugees from the Calabim lands seek sanctuary in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Refugiados de las tierras Calabim buscan asilo en la ciudad de %s2_city.

TEXT.English: They deserve better than the cruel oppression of the Calabim, invite them to join our city.
TEXT.French: Ils méritent mieux que la cruelle oppression des Calabions, invitez-les à s'installer en ville.
TEXT.German: Sie verdienen eine bessere Behandlung als unter der grausamen Tyrannei der Calabim. Bietet ihnen an, sich unserer Stadt anzuschließen.
TEXT.Italian: They deserve better than the cruel oppression of the Calabim, invite them to join our city.
TEXT.Spanish: Se merecen algo mejor que la cruel opresión de los Calabim, invitadles a unirse a nuestra ciudad.

TEXT.English: Refuse them, we cannot afford the enmity of the Calabim.
TEXT.French: Refusez-les, nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre de nous attirer l'inimitié des Calabions.
TEXT.German: Weist sie ab. Wir können uns keine Fehde mit den Calabim leisten.
TEXT.Italian: Refuse them, we cannot afford the enmity of the Calabim.
TEXT.Spanish: Rechazadlos, no podemos afrontar la enemistad con los Calabim.

TEXT.English: A carnival performer in %s2_city shows great talent.
TEXT.French: Un artiste du carnaval à %s2_city fait preuve d'un grand talent.
TEXT.German: Ein Schausteller in der Stadt %s2_city zeigt großes Talent.
TEXT.Italian: A carnival performer in %s2_city shows great talent.
TEXT.Spanish: Un artista de carnaval en %s2_city demuestra un gran talento.

TEXT.English: Raise the prices of the carnival.
TEXT.French: Augmentez les prix du Carnaval.
TEXT.German: Erhöht den Eintrittspreis des Jahrmarkts.
TEXT.Italian: Raise the prices of the carnival.
TEXT.Spanish: Eleva los precios del carnaval.

TEXT.English: Attend one of the shows yourself, it will bring fame to the city.
TEXT.French: Aller vous-même à l'un des spectacles, cela apportera la gloire à la ville.
TEXT.German: Ich werde mir das Spektakel selbst ansehen und den Ruhm der Stadt mehren.
TEXT.Italian: Attend one of the shows yourself, it will bring fame to the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Tú mismo vas a ver uno de los espectáculos, traerá fama a la ciudad.

TEXT.English: That talent is wasted juggling apples, press him into military service.
TEXT.French: Il gâche son talent à jongler avec des pommes, poussez-le à entrer dans l'armée.
TEXT.German: Äpfel jonglieren ist reine Talentverschwendung - Zwangsrekrutieren!
TEXT.Italian: That talent is wasted juggling apples, press him into military service.
TEXT.Spanish: Ese talento son malabarismos de manzanas gastadas, metedlo en el servicio militar.

TEXT.English: The Fellowship values such talent, allow them to recruit the performer.
TEXT.French: La Communauté révère de tels talents, leur permettre de recruter l'artiste (requiert la Communauté des Feuilles en religion d'état)
TEXT.German: Die Gefährten schätzen solches Talent. Erlaubt ihnen den Schausteller anzuwerben. ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]erforderlich: Gefährten des Laubes als Staatsreligion [ICON_RELIGION][COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Italian: The Fellowship values such talent, allow them to recruit the performer.
TEXT.Spanish: La Comunidad valora tales talentos, permitidles reclutar al artista.

TEXT.English: The people of %s2_city complain that centaurs walk their streets fully exposed. They seek a law that protects their modesty by forcing them to wear pants. The tailors' union supports the law.
TEXT.French: Les habitants de %s2_city se plaignent que les centaures marchent dans les rues totalement nus. Ils réclament une loi qui protègerait leur pudeur en les forçant à porter des pantalons. Le syndicat des tailleurs se dit favorable à cette loi.
TEXT.German: Die Bewohner der Stadt %s2_city beklagen sich, dass sich die Zentauren auf den Straßen vollkommen nackt zeigen. Sie verlangen ein Gesetz, das dem Anstand genüge tut, indem es sie dazu zwingt Hosen zu tragen. Die Schneiderzunft unterstützt das Gesetz.
TEXT.Italian: The people of %s2_city complain that centaurs walk their streets fully exposed. They seek a law that protects their modesty by forcing them to wear pants. The tailors' union supports the law.
TEXT.Spanish: The people of %s2_city complain that centaurs walk their streets fully exposed. They seek a law that protects their modesty by forcing them to wear pants. The tailors' union supports the law.

TEXT.English: This is not about modesty, the men just feel inferior in comparison. I will pass no such law.
TEXT.French: Ça n'a rien à voir avec la pudeur, les hommes se sentent juste inférieurs en comparaison. Je ne promulguerai pas ce genre de loi.
TEXT.German: Hier geht es nicht um Anstand. Die Männer fühlen sich einfach minderwertig im Vergleich. Ich werde kein solches Gesetz erlassen.
TEXT.Italian: This is not about modesty, the men just feel inferior in comparison. I will pass no such law.
TEXT.Spanish: This is not about modesty, the men just feel inferior in comparison. I will pass no such law.

TEXT.English: I'll gladly make that a law, but the centaur women can still go topless right?
TEXT.French: Bien sûr que j'écrirai cette loi, mais on est bien d'accord que les femmes centaures pourront toujours vivre seins nus ?
TEXT.German: Ich werde ein solches Gesetz gerne erlassen, aber die Zentauren-Frauen können sich immer noch oben ohne zeigen, oder?
TEXT.Italian: I'll gladly make that a law, but the centaur women can still go topless right?
TEXT.Spanish: I'll gladly make that a law, but the centaur women can still go topless right?

TEXT.English: The mage guild in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city is being disrupted by a willful student.
TEXT.French: la Guilde des Mages de la ville %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city est perturbée par un étudiant obstiné.
TEXT.German: Der Magische Zirkel der %[s1_civ_adjective]en Stadt %s2_city ist wegen eines eigensinnigen Lehrlings zerstritten.
TEXT.Italian: The mage guild in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city is being disrupted by a willful student.
TEXT.Spanish: El Gremio de Magos en la ciudad %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city está siendo desbaratado por un estudiante testarudo.

TEXT.English: The guildmaster of the mage guild in %s2_city asks for your help with a problem student. This student insists on trying wild theories that the guildmaster suspects could be quite dangerous, even if correct.
TEXT.French: Le maitre de guilde de la guilde des mages de %s2_city a besoin de votre aide avec un étudiant obstiné. Cet étudiant insiste pour tester des théories farfelues que le maitre de guilde considère comme potentiellement dangereuses, quand bien même elles seraient correctes.
TEXT.German: Der Meister des Magischen Zirkels der Stadt %s2_city bittet Euch um Hilfe. Einer der Lehrlinge beharrt darauf, wilde Theorien zu erproben, die laut dem Zirkelmeister sehr gefährlich sein könnten, auch wenn sie korrekt sein sollten.
TEXT.Italian: The guildmaster of the mage guild in %s2_city asks for your help with a problem student. This student insists on trying wild theories that the guildmaster suspects could be quite dangerous, even if correct.
TEXT.Spanish: El líder local del gremio de magos de %s2_city pide vuestra ayuda con un estudiante problemático. Este estudiante insiste en poner a prueba teorías salvajes que el maestro gremial sospecha podrían ser bastante peligrosas, incluso si salen bien.

TEXT.English: I will trust the judgment of the guildmaster. Exile the willful apprentice!
TEXT.French: Je fais confiance au jugement du maître de guilde. Exilez l'apprenti !
TEXT.German: Ich vertraue dem Urteil des Zirkelmeisters. Schickt den sturen Lehrling ins Exil!
TEXT.Italian: I will trust the judgment of the guildmaster. Exile the willful apprentice!
TEXT.Spanish: Confiaré en el juicio del maestro gremial. ¡Exiliad a ese estudiante testarudo!

TEXT.English: Your conservative approach to magic is getting us nowhere! This apprentice will be promoted to guildmaster, let him try his theories!
TEXT.French: Votre approche conservative de la magie ne nous mène nulle part ! Cet apprenti sera nommé maître de guilde, laissez-le tester ses théories !
TEXT.German: Konservative Ansätze bringen uns nicht weiter! Ernennt den Lehrling zum neuen Zirkelmeister und lasst ihn seine Theorien ausprobieren!
TEXT.Italian: Your conservative approach to magic is getting us nowhere! This apprentice will be promoted to guildmaster, let him try his theories!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Vuestro punto de vista conservador no nos lleva a ninguna parte! Este aprendiz será ascendido a maestro gremial, ¡dejemos que ponga a prueba sus teorías!

TEXT.English: Ok. Let's give this student a laboratory and a slave to test his ideas.
TEXT.French: Ok. Fournissez à cet étudiant un laboratoire et un esclave pour tester ses idées.
TEXT.German: Ok. Let's give this student a laboratory and a slave to test his ideas.
TEXT.Italian: Ok. Let's give this student a laboratory and a slave to test his ideas.
TEXT.Spanish: Ok. Let's give this student a laboratory and a slave to test his ideas.

TEXT.English: There are strange occurrences in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Des événements étranges ont lieu dans la ville %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: In der %[s1_civ_adjective]en Stadt %s2_city gehen seltsame Dinge vor sich.
TEXT.Italian: There are strange occurrences in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Ocurren cosas extrañas en la ciudad %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Citizens in %s2_city are worried about strange occurrences. Livestock are dying without cause, and some of the town wells have dried up. They suspect the mage guild is carrying out dangerous experiments!
TEXT.French: Les citoyens de %s2_city sont inquiets à propos d'événements étranges. Le bétail meurt sans raison, et certains des puits de la ville se sont asséchés. Ils suspectent la guilde des mages de mener des expériences dangereuses !
TEXT.German: Seltsame Geschehnisse besorgen die Bürger in der Stadt %s2_city. Ihr Vieh stirbt wie aus dem Nichts und einige der Stadtbrunnen sind ausgetrocknet. Sie vermuten, dass der Magische Zirkel gefährliche Experimente durchführt!
TEXT.Italian: Citizens in %s2_city are worried about strange occurrences. Livestock are dying without cause, and some of the town wells have dried up. They suspect the mage guild is carrying out dangerous experiments!
TEXT.Spanish: Los ciudadanos de %s2_city están preocupados acerca de unos extraños sucesos. El ganado está muriendo sin causa aparente, y algunos pozos del pueblo se han vaciado. ¡Sospechan que el gremio de magos está llevando a cabo experimentos peligrosos!

TEXT.English: Then we will destroy the mage guild!
TEXT.French: Alors nous détruirons la guilde des mages !
TEXT.German: Dann werden wir den Magischen Zirkel zerstören!
TEXT.Italian: Then we will destroy the mage guild!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Entonces destruiremos el gremio de magos!

TEXT.English: Cranky citizens are the price of progress!
TEXT.French: Des citoyens grincheux sont le prix du progrès !
TEXT.German: Missgelaunte Bürger sind der Preis des Fortschritts!
TEXT.Italian: Cranky citizens are the price of progress!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Los ciudadanos cabreados son el precio del progreso!

TEXT.English: A mage is performing bizarre experiments in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Un mage effectue des expériences bizarres dans la ville %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Ein Magier führt seltsame Experimente in der %[s1_civ_adjective]en Stadt %s2_city durch.
TEXT.Italian: A mage is performing bizarre experiments in the %s1_civ_adjective city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Un mago está llevando a cabo experimentos bizarros en la ciudad %s1_civ_adjective de %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Your tax collectors stumbled upon a disturbing scene in the mage guild in %s2_city! Townspeople have been abducted and experimented on! The guildmaster, Gaelan, offers to spread his teachings and increase the power of your mages if you let him continue, but a young man trapped by the guild begs you to free him.
TEXT.French: Vos collecteurs de taxes sont tombés sur une scène dérangeante à la guilde des mages de %s2_city ! Des citoyens ont été enlevés et ont servi de cobayes ! Le maître de guilde, Gaelan, propose d'enseigner ses découvertes et augmenter les pouvoirs de vos mages si vous le laissez continuer, mais un jeune homme capturé par la guilde vous prie de le libérer.
TEXT.German: Eure Steuereintreiber wurden Zeuge einer merkwürdigen Szene im Magischen Zirkel der Stadt %s2_city! Bürger werden dort entführt, um an ihnen zu experimentieren! Der Zirkelmeister bietet an, seine Lehre zu verbreiten und die Macht Eurer Magier zu vergrößern, wenn Ihr ihn gewähren lasst. Doch ein vom Zirkel gefangener Jüngling fleht Euch an, ihn zu befreien.
TEXT.Italian: Your tax collectors stumbled upon a disturbing scene in the mage guild in %s2_city! Townspeople have been abducted and experimented on! The guildmaster, Gaelan, offers to spread his teachings and increase the power of your mages if you let him continue, but a young man trapped by the guild begs you to free him.
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Vuestros recaudadores de impuestos se encontraron con una escena inesperada en el gremio de magos de %s2_city! ¡Los habitantes locales han sido abducidos y experimentado sobre ellos! El maestro gremial, Gaelan, ofrece propagar sus enseñanzas e incrementar el poder de vuestros magos si le dejáis continuar, pero un joven atrapado en el gremio os suplica que lo liberéis.

TEXT.English: Shut down this abomination!
TEXT.French: Fermez-moi cette abomination !
TEXT.German: Macht dieser Abscheulichkeit ein Ende!
TEXT.Italian: Shut down this abomination!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Acabad con esta abominación!

TEXT.English: Very well, let's keep this between us.
TEXT.French: Très bien, gardons cela entre nous.
TEXT.German: Also gut, das bleibt unter uns.
TEXT.Italian: Very well, let's keep this between us.
TEXT.Spanish: Muy bien, que quede entre nosotros.

TEXT.English: The innovative apprentice, Gaelan, requests an audience. He explains his first experiences had positive results and thinks he can obtain more if he's allowed two more test subjects.
TEXT.French: L'étudiant novateur, Gaelan, sollicite une audience. Il vous explique que ses premiers résultats ont été concluants et pense pouvoir obtenir de meilleurs résultats si vous lui fournissez 2 nouveaux cobayes.
TEXT.German: The innovative apprentice, Gaelan, requests an audience. He explains his first experiences had positive results and thinks he can obtain more if he's allowed two more test subjects.
TEXT.Italian: The innovative apprentice, Gaelan, requests an audience. He explains his first experiences had positive results and thinks he can obtain more if he's allowed two more test subjects.
TEXT.Spanish: The innovative apprentice, Gaelan, requests an audience. He explains his first experiences had positive results and thinks he can obtain more if he's allowed two more test subjects.

TEXT.English: Certainly not. Go back to your previous work.
TEXT.French: Certainement pas. Retournez à votre travail initial.
TEXT.German: Certainly not. Go back to your previous work.
TEXT.Italian: Certainly not. Go back to your previous work.
TEXT.Spanish: Certainly not. Go back to your previous work.

TEXT.English: Of course. The end justifies the means.
TEXT.French: Bien sûr. La fin justifie les moyens.
TEXT.German: Of course. The end justifies the means.
TEXT.Italian: Of course. The end justifies the means.
TEXT.Spanish: Of course. The end justifies the means.

TEXT.English: 2 test subjects ? Take 4 of them. It won't be long till our neighbours "graciously" give us replacement.
TEXT.French: 2 cobayes ? Prenez-en 4. Nos voisins nous fourniront très bientôt "gracieusement" des remplaçants.
TEXT.German: 2 test subjects ? Take 4 of them. It won't be long till our neighbours "graciously" give us replacement.
TEXT.Italian: 2 test subjects ? Take 4 of them. It won't be long till our neighbours "graciously" give us replacement.
TEXT.Spanish: 2 test subjects ? Take 4 of them. It won't be long till our neighbours "graciously" give us replacement.

TEXT.English: Angered that you sided against them, the merchants in %s2_city have hired a fire adept to set fire to the warehouses in your capital. The blaze rages out of control and threatens several of your buildings.
TEXT.French: Mécontents que vous vous soyiez opposé à eux, les marchands de %s2_city ont recruté un adepte du feu pour incendier les entrepôts de votre capitale. Les flammes se déchaînent hors de contrôle et menacent plusieurs bâtiments.
TEXT.German: Da die Händler der Stadt %s2_city verärgert waren, dass Ihr Euch gegen sie gestellt habt, haben sie einen Adepten angeheuert, der die Lagerhäuser Eurer Hauptstadt niederbrennen sollte. Die Feuersbrunst wütet nun unkontrollierbar und bedroht einige Eurer Gebäude.
TEXT.Italian: Angered that you sided against them, the merchants in %s2_city have hired a fire adept to set fire to the warehouses in your capital. The blaze rages out of control and threatens several of your buildings.
TEXT.Spanish: Angered that you sided against them, the merchants in %s2_city have hired a fire adept to set fire to the warehouses in your capital. The blaze rages out of control and threatens several of your buildings.

TEXT.English: Let the local watch handle it.
TEXT.French: Laissez le guet de la ville s'en occuper.
TEXT.German: Lasst das die lokale Wache in den Griff bekommen.
TEXT.Italian: Let the local watch handle it.
TEXT.Spanish: Let the local watch handle it.

TEXT.English: Press the adept into service for his crimes.
TEXT.French: Enrôlez l'adepte pour expier ses crimes.
TEXT.German: Zwingt den Adepten für seine Verbrechen in unsere Dienste.
TEXT.Italian: Press the adept into service for his crimes.
TEXT.Spanish: Press the adept into service for his crimes.

TEXT.English: This will end now, a few years of hard labor should keep these merchants out of any trouble.
TEXT.French: Ça se finit maintenant, et quelques années de dur labeur devraient persuader ces marchands de ne plus causer de problèmes.
TEXT.German: Dies hört jetzt auf. Einige Jahre harter Arbeit sollten diese Händler aus jedem weiteren Ärger heraushalten.
TEXT.Italian: This will end now, a few years of hard labor should keep these merchants out of any trouble.
TEXT.Spanish: This will end now, a few years of hard labor should keep these merchants out of any trouble.

TEXT.English: The conflicts between the merchants in %s1_city and your capital have escalated. This time the merchants in your capital have hired mercenary raiders to prey on the trade routes of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Les tensions entre les marchands de %s1_city et de votre capitale ont dégénéré. Cette fois les marchands de votre capitale ont recruté des pillards mercenaires pour razzier les routes commerciales de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die Auseinandersetzung zwischen den Händlern der Stadt %s1_city und Eurer Hauptstadt sind eskaliert. Dieses Mal haben die Händler Eurer Hauptstadt geldgierige Wegelagerer angeheuert, die die Handelskarawanen von und nach %s2_city ausrauben sollen.
TEXT.Italian: The conflicts between the merchants in %s1_city and your capital have escalated. This time the merchants in your capital have hired mercenary raiders to prey on the trade routes of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: The conflicts between the merchants in %s1_city and your capital have escalated. This time the merchants in your capital have hired mercenary raiders to prey on the trade routes of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Let the local watch handle it.
TEXT.French: Laissez le guet de la ville s'en occuper.
TEXT.German: Lasst das die lokale Wache in den Griff bekommen.
TEXT.Italian: Let the local watch handle it.
TEXT.Spanish: Let the local watch handle it.

TEXT.English: Press the mercenary into service for his crimes.
TEXT.French: Enrôlez le mercenaire pour expier ses crimes.
TEXT.German: Zwingt die Wegelagerer für ihre Verbrechen in unsere Dienste.
TEXT.Italian: Press the mercenary into service for his crimes.
TEXT.Spanish: Press the mercenary into service for his crimes.

TEXT.English: Punish the merchants in both cities, this must end.
TEXT.French: Punissez les marchands des deux villes, ça doit s'arrêter maintenant.
TEXT.German: Bestraft die Händler in beiden Städten. Dies muss aufhören.
TEXT.Italian: Punish the merchants in both cities, this must end.
TEXT.Spanish: Punish the merchants in both cities, this must end.

TEXT.English: Recently, the merchants in your capital have had lots of trouble with their trade. Bandits are well armed, traders have had their homes broken into, and members of trade caravans have been bribed to abandon their charges. An investigation has shown the blame to lie with the merchants of %s2_city, who seek to increase their own profits by hurting their competitor.
TEXT.French: Récemment, les marchands de votre capitale ont eu de nombreux problèmes dans leurs écahnges. Les bandits sont bien armés, les marchands ont eu leur maison cambriolée, et les membres des caravanes commerciales ont été corrompus pour abandonner leur cargaison. Une enquête a incriminé les marchands de %s2_city, qui cherchent à augmenter leurs profits en nuisant à leurs conccurents.
TEXT.German: Seit Kurzem haben die Händler Eurer Hauptstadt reichlich Ärger mit ihren Geschäften. Banditen sind erstaunlich gut ausgerüstet, in die Häuser der Händler wird immer öfter eingebrochen und Mitglieder von Handelskarawanen werden bestochen, damit sie den Aufbruch der Karawane verpassen. Eine Untersuchung hat ergeben, dass die Schuld dafür bei den Händlern der Stadt %s2_city zu suchen ist, die ihre Gewinne auf Kosten ihrer Konkurrenten steigern wollen.
TEXT.Italian: Recently, the merchants in your capital have had lots of trouble with their trade. Bandits are well armed, traders have had their homes broken into, and members of trade caravans have been bribed to abandon their charges. An investigation has shown the blame to lie with the merchants of %s2_city, who seek to increase their own profits by hurting their competitor.
TEXT.Spanish: Recently, the merchants in your capital have had lots of trouble with their trade. Bandits are well armed, traders have had their homes broken into, and members of trade caravans have been bribed to abandon their charges. An investigation has shown the blame to lie with the merchants of %s2_city, who seek to increase their own profits by hurting their competitor.

TEXT.English: Compensate the merchants in your capital for their damages, and present a gift to the merchants that are causing the problem in return for a promise to cease such activities.
TEXT.French: Indemnisez les marchands de la capitale, et proposez un don aux marchands responsables de ces troubles contre la promesse de cesser de telles activités.
TEXT.German: Ersetzt den Händlern der Hauptstadt die enstandenen Schäden und beschenkt die Händler, die das Problem verursacht haben, im Austausch für das Versprechen solche Umtriebe einzustellen.
TEXT.Italian: Compensate the merchants in your capital for their damages, and present a gift to the merchants that are causing the problem in return for a promise to cease such activities.
TEXT.Spanish: Compensate the merchants in your capital for their damages, and present a gift to the merchants that are causing the problem in return for a promise to cease such activities.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPY] in %s1_city for 5 turns
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPY] à %s1_city pendant 5 tours
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPY] in %s1_city für 5 Runden
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPY] in %s1_city for 5 turns
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]+1 [ICON_HAPPY] in %s1_city for 5 turns

TEXT.English: Waste no time in seeking out the guilty parties and bringing them in front of justice, making a public example out of them.
TEXT.French: Ne perdez pas de temps à rechercher les coupables. Amenez-les tous devant la justice, et faites-en un exemple
TEXT.German: Verschwendet keine Zeit bei der Verhaftung der Schuldigen und tut der Gerechtigkeit genüge, indem an ihnen ein öffentliches Exempel statuiert wird.
TEXT.Italian: Waste no time in seeking out the guilty parties and bringing them in front of justice, making a public example out of them.
TEXT.Spanish: Waste no time in seeking out the guilty parties and bringing them in front of justice, making a public example out of them.

TEXT.English: Don't interfere. Defending themselves against these attacks will make the traders in the capital more capable of defending themselves against other sabotage.
TEXT.French: N'intervenez pas. Se défendre contre les assaillants apprendra aux marchands de la capitale à se mieux se prémunir contre de futurs sabotages.
TEXT.German: Greift nicht ein. Wenn sie sich selbst gegen solche Angriffe verteidigen müssen, werden die Händler der Hauptstadt künftig besser imstande sein, sich auch gegen andere Arten der Sabotage zu verteidigen.
TEXT.Italian: Don't interfere. Defending themselves against these attacks will make the traders in the capital more capable of defending themselves against other sabotage.
TEXT.Spanish: Don't interfere. Defending themselves against these attacks will make the traders in the capital more capable of defending themselves against other sabotage.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]5 [ICON_UNHAPPY] temporarily in %s1_city
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]5 [ICON_UNHAPPY] temporairement à %s1_city
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]5 [ICON_UNHAPPY] in %s1_city für einige Runden
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]5 [ICON_UNHAPPY] temporarily in %s1_city
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]5 [ICON_UNHAPPY] temporarily in %s1_city

TEXT.English: The people of %s2_city want to form their own nation under Minister Koun, a local politician. Our advisors warn that refusing their request could create bad will in the city, and allowing them to form their own nation could provide a good ally.
TEXT.French: Les habitants de %s2_city veulent fonder leur propre nation dirigée par le ministre Koun, un politicien local. Nos conseillers nous mettent en garde : refuser leur requête pourrait créer une atmosphère néfaste dans la ville, et accepter qu'ils fondent leur propre nation pourrait nous fournir un bon allié.
TEXT.German: Die Bevölkerung der Stadt %s2_city will unter Minister Koun, einem lokalen Politiker, ein eigenes Reich errichten. Eure Berater warnen, dass eine Ablehnung ihrer Forderung Euren Ruf in dieser Stadt verschlechtern könnte. Eure Zustimmung zu diesem Vorhaben könnte hingegen einen loyalen Verbündeten hervorbringen.
TEXT.Italian: The people of %s2_city want to form their own nation under Minister Koun, a local politician. Our advisors warn that refusing their request could create bad will in the city, and allowing them to form their own nation could provide a good ally.
TEXT.Spanish: The people of %s2_city want to form their own nation under Minister Koun, a local politician. Our advisors warn that refusing their request could create bad will in the city, and allowing them to form their own nation could provide a good ally.

TEXT.English: Allow the people to do as they desire.
TEXT.French: Permettez leur de faire ce qu'ils veulent.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt den Leuten, zu tun, was ihnen beliebt.
TEXT.Italian: Allow the people to do as they desire.
TEXT.Spanish: Allow the people to do as they desire.

TEXT.English: Send in guards from other cities to make sure we maintain control, jail Koun for treason.
TEXT.French: Envoyez des gardes des autres villes pour s'assurer qu'ils maîtrisent la situation, et emprisonnez Koun pour trahison.
TEXT.German: Schickt Wachen aus anderen Städten, um unsere Herrschaft über die Stadt zu sichern, und werft Koun wegen Hochverrats ins Gefängnis.
TEXT.Italian: Send in guards from other cities to make sure we maintain control, jail Koun for treason.
TEXT.Spanish: Send in guards from other cities to make sure we maintain control, jail Koun for treason.

TEXT.English: Contact the assassins' guild, make it look like one of Koun's rivals is responsible for his death.
TEXT.French: Contactez la guilde des assassins, et faites en sorte que la mort de Koun semble due à un de ses rivaux.
TEXT.German: Nehmt Kontakt mit Aerons Finsterer Gabe auf und lasst es so aussehen, als ob einer von Kouns Gegnern für seinen Tod verantwortlich ist.
TEXT.Italian: Contact the assassins' guild, make it look like one of Koun's rivals is responsible for his death.
TEXT.Spanish: Contact the assassins' guild, make it look like one of Koun's rivals is responsible for his death.

TEXT.English: Kill Koun, kill any populace that complains, and kill the messenger that delivered this ridiculous request.
TEXT.French: Tuez Koun, tuez tous ceux qui se plaignent, et tuez le messager qui a apporté cette requête ridicule.
TEXT.German: Tötet Koun, tötet jeden, der es wagt, sich zu widersetzen, und tötet den Boten, der diese lächerliche Forderung überbracht hat.
TEXT.Italian: Kill Koun, kill any populace that complains, and kill the messenger that delivered this ridiculous request.
TEXT.Spanish: Kill Koun, kill any populace that complains, and kill the messenger that delivered this ridiculous request.

TEXT.English: Years ago an adventurer in %s2_city helped defeat a band of harpies. He found a lone egg in the harpies' nest, kept it and raised the hatchling in secret as his daughter, naming her Clairone. Recently the city found out about the "creature" being raised within the city and are calling to have her killed. She is a hideous-looking beast, but is said to have a singing voice so beautiful she can make the trees weep. What should we do?
TEXT.French: Il y a des années un aventurier de %s2_city a contribué à battre un groupe de harpies. Il a trouvé un œuf solitaire dans le nid des harpies, l'a conservé et a élevé en secret l'oisillon comme sa fille, l'appelant Clairone. Récemment les habitants ont découvert la vérité sur cette "créature" élevée dans la ville et demande à ce qu'elle soit tuée. C'est une créature d'apparence hideuse, mais on dit qu'elle a une voix de chanteuse si belle qu'elle peut même faire pleurer les arbres. Que devons-nous faire ?
TEXT.German: Vor einigen Jahren half ein Abenteurer in der Stadt %s2_city dabei, eine Gruppe von Harpyien zu besiegen. Er fand ein einzelnes Ei im Nest der Harpyien, behielt es und zog das Junge im Geheimen als seine Tochter auf, die er Clairone nannte. Kürzlich erfuhren die Bürger der Stadt von der "Kreatur", die in ihrer Stadt aufgezogen wurde, und verlangen ihren Tod. Sie ist eine abscheulich aussehende Bestie, aber es heißt, ihr Gesang sei so schön, dass sie die Bäume zum Weinen bringen könne. Was sollen wir tun?
TEXT.Italian: Years ago an adventurer in %s2_city helped defeat a band of harpies. He found a lone egg in the harpies' nest, kept it and raised the hatchling in secret as his daughter, naming her Clairone. Recently the city found out about the "creature" being raised within the city and are calling to have her killed. She is a hideous-looking beast, but is said to have a singing voice so beautiful she can make the trees weep. What should we do?
TEXT.Spanish: Years ago an adventurer in %s2_city helped defeat a band of harpies. He found a lone egg in the harpies' nest, kept it and raised the hatchling in secret as his daughter, naming her Clairone. Recently the city found out about the "creature" being raised within the city and are calling to have her killed. She is a hideous-looking beast, but is said to have a singing voice so beautiful she can make the trees weep. What should we do?

TEXT.English: What is next, someone raising a Pyre Zombie as a son? Have her killed.
TEXT.French: Et après ce sera quoi ? Quelqu'un qui élève un pyro zombie comme un fils ? Tuez la.
TEXT.German: Was kommt als nächstes? Jemand, der einen Pyro-Zombie als Sohn aufzieht? Lasst sie töten.
TEXT.Italian: What is next, someone raising a Pyre Zombie as a son? Have her killed.
TEXT.Spanish: What is next, someone raising a Pyre Zombie as a son? Have her killed.

TEXT.English: Order the city guard to protect the girl, she is a citizen of our empire now.
TEXT.French: Ordonnez aux gardes de la ville de protéger la fille, elle est aujourd'hui un citoyen de notre empire.
TEXT.German: Befehlt der Stadtwache, das Mädchen zu beschützen. Sie ist nun eine Bürgerin unseres Reiches.
TEXT.Italian: Order the city guard to protect the girl, she is a citizen of our empire now.
TEXT.Spanish: Order the city guard to protect the girl, she is a citizen of our empire now.

TEXT.English: Continue
TEXT.French: Continuez
TEXT.German: Fortsetzen
TEXT.Italian: Continue
TEXT.Spanish: Continuar

TEXT.English: A philosopher from %s2_city is stirring up controversy among our population. Our people are highly distrustful of his teachings.
TEXT.French: Un philosophe de %s2_city a jeté le trouble parmi nos gens qui se méfient fortement de ses enseignements.
TEXT.German: Ein Philosoph aus %s2_city löst Kontroversen innerhalb unserer Bevölkerung aus. Seine Lehren machen die Leute argwöhnisch.
TEXT.Italian: Un filosofo di %s2_city sta scatenando una controversia all'interno della nostra popolazione. I nostri cittadini sono molto diffidenti nei confronti dei suoi insegnamenti.
TEXT.Spanish: Un filósofo de %s2_city esta levantando controversia entre nuestra población. Nuestra gente esta realmente disgustada con sus enseñanzas.

TEXT.English: We won't tolerate such heresy. Send him into exile!
TEXT.French: Nous ne tolèrerons aucune hérésie. Bannissez-le !
TEXT.German: Derartige Ketzerei wird nicht toleriert. Schickt ihn ins Exil!
TEXT.Italian: Non tollereremo un'eresia simile. Mandatelo in esilio!
TEXT.Spanish: No toleraremos tal herejia. Mandarlo al exilio!

TEXT.English: That's one exceptional mind! Sponsor an Academy for him to teach!
TEXT.French: Son intellect est exceptionnel ! Proposons-lui une chaire où il puisse enseigner !
TEXT.German: Würdigt diesen außergewöhnlichen Geist durch die Errichtung einer eigenen Akademie!
TEXT.Italian: Quest'uomo è dotato di una mente eccezionale. Mandatelo ad insegnare in un'accademia!
TEXT.Spanish: Es una mente excepcional! Patrocinar una Academia para sus enseñanzas!

TEXT.English: Your financial advisor reports that the economy of %s2_city is suffering. It could be the work of a few corrupt merchants, or the actions of the Stewards of Inequity. How should we respond?
TEXT.French: Votre conseiller financier vous alerte sur le fait que l'économie de %s2_city souffre. Ça peut être dû à quelques marcahnds corrompus, ou aux actions des Intendants de l'Inéquité. Comment devrions-nous réagir ?
TEXT.German: Euer Schatzmeister berichtet, dass die Wirtschaft der Stadt %s2_city leidet. Dies könnte durch das Werk einiger korrupter Händler oder durch die Aktivität der Verwalter der Ungerechtigkeit verursacht worden sein. Was sollen wir unternehmen?
TEXT.Italian: Your financial advisor reports that the economy of %s2_city is suffering. It could be the work of a few corrupt merchants, or the actions of the Stewards of Inequity. How should we respond?
TEXT.Spanish: Your financial advisor reports that the economy of %s2_city is suffering. It could be the work of a few corrupt merchants, or the actions of the Stewards of Inequity. How should we respond?

TEXT.English: There is little we can do.
TEXT.French: Il n'y a rien que l'on puisse faire.
TEXT.German: Wir können daran kaum etwas ändern.
TEXT.Italian: There is little we can do.
TEXT.Spanish: There is little we can do.

TEXT.English: For a slight bribe the thieves' guild can handle this for us.
TEXT.French: Contre un petit pot-de-vin la guilde des voleurs pourrait s'en charger à notre place.
TEXT.German: Die Rattenfängergilde soll, für einen geringfügigen Lohn, die Sache für uns erledigen.
TEXT.Italian: For a slight bribe the thieves' guild can handle this for us.
TEXT.Spanish: For a slight bribe the thieves' guild can handle this for us.

TEXT.English: The priests of Kilmorph will not be happy to learn that their tithes are being stolen, allow them to deal with the situation as they please.
TEXT.French: Les prêtres de Kilmorph ne sont pas ravis d'apprendre que leurs dîmes sont volées. Permettez leur de résoudre le problème comme ils le souhaitent.
TEXT.German: Die Priester von Kilmorph werden nicht sehr glücklich sein, wenn sie erfahren, dass ihr Zehnter einfach gestohlen wird. Lasst sie sich um die Situation kümmern, wie sie es für richtig halten.
TEXT.Italian: The priests of Kilmorph will not be happy to learn that their tithes are being stolen, allow them to deal with the situation as they please.
TEXT.Spanish: The priests of Kilmorph will not be happy to learn that their tithes are being stolen, allow them to deal with the situation as they please.

TEXT.English: Local merchants are reporting counterfeit gold coins in their treasuries. Many will go out of business if you don't help.
TEXT.French: Les marchands locaux indiquent avoir trouvé de la fausse-monnaie dans leurs caisses. Beaucoup feront faillite sans votre aide.
TEXT.German: Örtliche Händler berichten, dass sich gefälschte Goldmünzen in ihren Kassen befinden. Viele werden ihr Geschäft aufgeben müssen, falls Ihr nicht helft.
TEXT.Italian: Local merchants are reporting counterfeit gold coins in their treasuries. Many will go out of business if you don't help.
TEXT.Spanish: Local merchants are reporting counterfeit gold coins in their treasuries. Many will go out of business if you don't help.

TEXT.English: If they were fools enough to collect the coins then they should suffer for it.
TEXT.French: S'ils ont été assez bêtes pour les encaisser, alors ils doivent en payer les conséquences.
TEXT.German: Wenn sie dumm genug waren, die Münzen anzunehmen, sollten sie auch dafür büßen.
TEXT.Italian: If they were fools enough to collect the coins then they should suffer for it.
TEXT.Spanish: If they were fools enough to collect the coins then they should suffer for it.

TEXT.English: Pay for a portion of the counterfeit coins, and order the guards to watch closely for any more of them.
TEXT.French: Versez un pourcentage des fausses pièces et ordonnez aux gardes de surveiller attentivement l'apparition de toute nouvelle pièce.
TEXT.German: Tauscht einen Teil der Münzen gegen echte ein und befehlt den Wachen, genau zu beobachten, ob weitere auftauchen.
TEXT.Italian: Pay for a portion of the counterfeit coins, and order the guards to watch closely for any more of them.
TEXT.Spanish: Pay for a portion of the counterfeit coins, and order the guards to watch closely for any more of them.

TEXT.English: Prayers to Kilmorph will transform these from lead to true gold.
TEXT.French: Les prières à Kilmorph les transformeront de plomb en vrai or.
TEXT.German: Gebete an Kilmorph werden das Blei dieser Münzen in echtes Gold verwandeln.
TEXT.Italian: Prayers to Kilmorph will transform these from lead to true gold.
TEXT.Spanish: Prayers to Kilmorph will transform these from lead to true gold.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 to the Crime Rate
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 au taux de criminalité
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 zur Verbrechensrate
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 to the Crime Rate
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 al Índice de Criminalidad

TEXT.English: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has decreased in his city. He credits the reduction to the vigilance of the city watch.
TEXT.French: Le gouverneur de %s2_city indique que la criminalité a baissé dans sa ville. Il croit que le mérite en revient à la vigilance du guet de la ville.
TEXT.German: Der Bürgermeister der Stadt %s2_city berichtet, dass die Verbrechen in seiner Stadt zurückgegangen sind. Er führt diesen Rückgang auf die Wachsamkeit der Stadtwache zurück.
TEXT.Italian: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has decreased in his city. He credits the reduction to the vigilance of the city watch.
TEXT.Spanish: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has decreased in his city. He credits the reduction to the vigilance of the city watch.

TEXT.English: Congratulate the governor and his men for their fine work.
TEXT.French: Félicitez le gouverneur et ses hommes pour leur bon travail.
TEXT.German: Gartuliert dem Bürgermeister und seinen Männern für ihre gute Arbeit.
TEXT.Italian: Congratulate the governor and his men for their fine work.
TEXT.Spanish: Congratulate the governor and his men for their fine work.

TEXT.English: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has increased in his city. He claims that the city's growing economy has attracted an assortment of criminals.
TEXT.French: Le gouverneur de %s2_city indique que la criminalité a augmenté dans sa ville et clame que l'économie grandissante de la ville a attiré tout un panel de criminels.
TEXT.German: Der Bürgermeister der Stadt %s2_city berichtet, dass die Verbrechen in seiner Stadt zugenommen haben. Er behauptet, dass die wachsende Wirtschaft der Stadt eine große Auswahl von Kriminellen angelockt hat.
TEXT.Italian: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has increased in his city. He claims that the city's growing economy has attracted an assortment of criminals.
TEXT.Spanish: The governor of %s2_city reports that crime has increased in his city. He claims that the city's growing economy has attracted an assortment of criminals.

TEXT.English: Order the governor to refocus his men to preventing crime in the city.
TEXT.French: Ordonnez au gouverneur de recentrer ses hommes sur la prévention du crime dans la ville.
TEXT.German: Befehlt dem Bürgermeister, seine Männer verstärkt für die Verbrechensbekämpfung in der Stadt einzusetzen.
TEXT.Italian: Order the governor to refocus his men to preventing crime in the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Order the governor to refocus his men to preventing crime in the city.

TEXT.English: I am not interested in this offer.
TEXT.French: Je ne suis pas intéressé par cette offre.
TEXT.German: Ich bin an dem Angebot nicht interessiert.
TEXT.Italian: I am not interested in this offer.
TEXT.Spanish: No tengo interés por esta oferta.

TEXT.English: The people of %s2_city marvel at their monument, but it needs an inscription. Who should they dedicate it to?
TEXT.French: Les habitants de %s2_city s'extasient devant leur monument, mais il nécessite une inscription. À qui devrions-nous le dédier ?
TEXT.German: Die Bevölkerung der Stadt %s2_city bestaunt ihr Monument, aber es benötigt noch eine Inschrift. Wem sollen sie das Monument widmen?
TEXT.Italian: The people of %s2_city marvel at their monument, but it needs an inscription. Who should they dedicate it to?
TEXT.Spanish: The people of %s2_city marvel at their monument, but it needs an inscription. Who should they dedicate it to?

TEXT.English: Amathaon, the God of Fertility
TEXT.French: Amathaon, le Dieu de la Fertilité
TEXT.German: Amathaon, dem Gott der Fruchtbarkeit
TEXT.Italian: Amathaon, the God of Fertility
TEXT.Spanish: A Amateón, el dios de la Fertilidad

TEXT.English: Sucellus, the God of Growth
TEXT.French: Sucellus, le Dieu de la Croissance
TEXT.German: Sucellus, dem Gott des Wachstums
TEXT.Italian: Sucellus, the God of Growth
TEXT.Spanish: A Sucellus, el dios del Desarrollo

TEXT.English: Oghma, the God of Knowledge
TEXT.French: Oghma, le Dieu du Savoir
TEXT.German: Oghma, dem Gott des Wissens
TEXT.Italian: Oghma, the God of Knowledge
TEXT.Spanish: A Oghma, el dios del Conocimiento

TEXT.English: Mammon, the God of Greed
TEXT.French: Mammon, le Dieu de l'Avidité
TEXT.German: Mammon, dem Gott der Gier
TEXT.Italian: Mammon, the God of Greed
TEXT.Spanish: A Mammon, el dios de la Codicia

TEXT.English: Mulcarn, the former God of Winter
TEXT.French: Mulcarn, l'ancien Dieu de l'Hiver
TEXT.German: Mulcarn, dem früheren Gott des Winters
TEXT.Italian: Mulcarn, the former God of Winter
TEXT.Spanish: A Mulcarn, el legítimo dios del Invierno.

TEXT.English: Do not praise the divine, they did not create the sculpture, inscribe the name of the artist.
TEXT.French: Ne remerciez pas les dieux, ils n'ont pas créé la statue. Inscrivez le nom de l'artiste.
TEXT.German: Lobpreist nicht die Götter. Sie haben die Skulptur nicht errichtet. Widmet die Inschrift dem Künstler.
TEXT.Italian: Do not praise the divine, they did not create the sculpture, inscribe the name of the artist.
TEXT.Spanish: No adoréis a lo divino, ellos no crearon la escultura, inscribid el nombre del escultor.

TEXT.English: Death itself
TEXT.French: La Mort elle-même
TEXT.German: Death itself
TEXT.Italian: Death itself
TEXT.Spanish: Death itself

TEXT.English: Your explorers have uncovered a tome from the Age of Magic. It radiates an unholy aura, but may yield secrets from that age.
TEXT.French: Vos explorateurs ont découvert un grimoire datant de l'Âge de la Magie. Il irradie d'une aura impie, mais pourrait contenir des secrets de cet âge.
TEXT.German: Eure Entdecker sind auf ein Zauberbuch aus dem Zeitalter der Magie gestoßen. Es strahlt eine unheilige Aura aus, aber es könnte verlorene Geheimnisse beherbergen.
TEXT.Italian: Your explorers have uncovered a tome from the Age of Magic. It radiates an unholy aura, but may yield secrets from that age.
TEXT.Spanish: Vuestros exploradores han encontrado un tomo de la Edad de la Magia. Irradia un aura maldita, pero puede guardar secretos de esa edad.

TEXT.English: Have the tome studied, we will not be restrained by our fear.
TEXT.French: Faites étudier le grimoire, ne laissons pas la peur nous guider.
TEXT.German: Lasst das Buch untersuchen. Wir dürfen uns nicht von unseren Ängsten behindern lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Have the tome studied, we will not be restrained by our fear.
TEXT.Spanish: Estudiad el tomo, no seremos controlados por nuestro miedo.

TEXT.English: Burn the tome, the teachings of demons always come with a price.
TEXT.French: Brûlez le grimoire, les enseignements des démons ont toujours un prix.
TEXT.German: Verbrennt das Buch. Für die Lehren der Dämonen muss man immer einen hohen Preis zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Burn the tome, the teachings of demons always come with a price.
TEXT.Spanish: Quemad el tomo, las enseñanzas de los demonios siempre vienen con un precio.

TEXT.English: A citizen of %s2_city is standing in the town square yelling that you are incompetent and challenging your rule.
TEXT.French: Un citoyen de %s2_city se dresse sur la grand-place, hurlant que vous êtes un incompétent et vous défiant.
TEXT.German: Ein Bürger der Stadt %s2_city steht auf dem Stadtplatz, verbreitet, dass Ihr unfähig seid, und stellt Eure Gesetze in Frage.
TEXT.Italian: A citizen of %s2_city is standing in the town square yelling that you are incompetent and challenging your rule.
TEXT.Spanish: Un ciudadano de %s2_city está de pie en la plaza de la ciudad protestando a gritos que vos sois incompetente, desafiando vuestro gobierno.

TEXT.English: Ignore him.
TEXT.French: Ignorez le.
TEXT.German: Ignoriert ihn.
TEXT.Italian: Ignore him.
TEXT.Spanish: Ignoradlo.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Has a 50% chance of causing a revolt for 2 turns.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]a 50% de chances de causer une révolte pendant 2 tours.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]50% Chance, dass für 2 Runden eine Revolte ausbricht
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Has a 50% chance of causing a revolt for 2 turns.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Hay un 50% de probabilidades de provocar una revuelta durante 2 turnos.

TEXT.English: Debate his concerns publicly.
TEXT.French: Organisez un débat public avec lui.
TEXT.German: Fordert ihn zu einer öffentlichen Debatte auf.
TEXT.Italian: Debate his concerns publicly.
TEXT.Spanish: Debatid sus argumentos públicamente.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Has a 50% chance of adding +1 [ICON_HAPPY], otherwise the city revolts for 4 turns.
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]a 50% de chances d'ajouter +1 [ICON_HAPPY], sinon la ville se révolte pour 4 tours.
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]50% Chance für +1[ICON_HAPPY], andernfalls revoltiert die Stadt für 4 Runden
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Has a 50% chance of adding +1 [ICON_HAPPY], otherwise the city revolts for 4 turns.
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Hay un 50% de probabilidades de añadir +1 [ICON_HAPPY], en caso contrario habrá una revuelta durante 4 turnos.

TEXT.English: Have him whipped for speaking out against you.
TEXT.French: Faites le disparaître pour s'être dressé contre nous.
TEXT.German: Peitscht ihn für diese Unverschämtheit aus!
TEXT.Italian: Have him whipped for speaking out against you.
