TEXT.Spanish: Le hacéis desaparecer por hablar en contra vuestra.

TEXT.English: The people will not stand for such heresy, allow them to stone him. (requires the Social Order civic)
TEXT.French: Le peuple ne tolèrera pas une telle hérésie, permettez leur de le lapider. (requiert la doctrine Ordre Social)
TEXT.German: Die Bürger werden solch Ketzerei nicht gutheißen. Erlaubt ihnen den Kerl zu steinigen. ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]erforderlich: Gesellschaftsform "Sozialer Frieden"[COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Italian: The people will not stand for such heresy, allow them to stone him. (requires the Social Order civic)
TEXT.Spanish: El pueblo no tolerará tal herejía, dejadles lapidarlo. (requiere la doctrina Orden Social)

TEXT.English: Ask the guildmaster of the assassins' guild to take care of the problem.
TEXT.French: Demandez au maître de la guilde des assassins de s'occuper du problème.
TEXT.German: Bittet die Meuchelmörder der Bruderschaft, sich der Sache anzunehmen. ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]erforderlich: Gilde "Aerons Finstere Gabe"[COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Italian: Ask the guildmaster of the assassins' guild to take care of the problem.
TEXT.Spanish: Le pedís al maestro gremial del gremio de asesinos que se encargue del problema.

TEXT.English: You have been restless lately, visions of death and destruction haunt you.
TEXT.French: Vous ne parvenez pas à vos reposer ces derniers temps, hanté par des visions de mort et de destruction.
TEXT.German: Seit kurzem seid Ihr ruhelos. Visionen des Todes und des Untergangs verfolgen Euch.
TEXT.Italian: You have been restless lately, visions of death and destruction haunt you.
TEXT.Spanish: Ultimamente habéis estado inquieto, visiones de muerte y destrucción os persiguen.

TEXT.English: Ignore them, I'll be fine.
TEXT.French: Ignorez-les, je vais bien.
TEXT.German: Ignoriert sie. Mir geht es gut.
TEXT.Italian: Ignore them, I'll be fine.
TEXT.Spanish: No importa, estaré bien.

TEXT.English: Make a sacrifice at a local temple.
TEXT.French: Faites un sacrifice au temple local.
TEXT.German: Bringt am örtlichen Tempel ein Opfer.
TEXT.Italian: Make a sacrifice at a local temple.
TEXT.Spanish: Haced un sacrificio en el templo local.

TEXT.English: These dreams will guide us.
TEXT.French: Ces rêves nous guideront.
TEXT.German: Diese Träume werden uns leiten.
TEXT.Italian: These dreams will guide us.
TEXT.Spanish: Estos sueños nos guiarán.

TEXT.English: No wonder I've been in such a good mood lately.
TEXT.French: C'est donc pour ça que je suis d'aussi bonne humeur ces derniers temps !
TEXT.German: Kein Wunder, dass ich in letzter Zeit so eine gute Laune habe.
TEXT.Italian: No wonder I've been in such a good mood lately.
TEXT.Spanish: Me preguntaba por qué había estado de tan buen humor últimamente.

TEXT.English: An aging explorer offers to sell you a map to a hidden dungeon. He found it years ago but wasn't brave enough to explore it. For enough gold to retire he will sell you the map.
TEXT.French: Un vieil aventurier vous propose de vous vendre une carte d'un donjon caché. Il l'a trouvée il y a des années, mais n'était pas assez courageux pour l'explorer. Contre assez d'argent pour ses vieux jours, il accepte de vous vendre la carte.
TEXT.German: Ein alternder Entdecker bietet Euch eine Karte zu einem verborgenen Verlies an. Er fand sie vor Jahren, war jedoch nicht mutig genug, das Verlies selbst zu erkunden. Für genügend Gold, mit dem er sich zu Ruhe setzen kann, wird er sie Euch verkaufen.
TEXT.Italian: An aging explorer offers to sell you a map to a hidden dungeon. He found it years ago but wasn't brave enough to explore it. For enough gold to retire he will sell you the map.
TEXT.Spanish: An aging explorer offers to sell you a map to a hidden dungeon. He found it years ago but wasn't brave enough to explore it. For enough gold to retire he will sell you the map.

TEXT.English: I'll purchase the map, I'll have our men explore it.
TEXT.French: J'achèterai la carte, et enverrai mes hommes l'explorer.
TEXT.German: Ich werde diese Karte kaufen, unsere Männer werden das Verlies erkunden.
TEXT.Italian: I'll purchase the map, I'll have our men explore it.
TEXT.Spanish: I'll purchase the map, I'll have our men explore it.

TEXT.English: Let it remain hidden, there is no need to awaken whatever lies within it.
TEXT.French: Laissez le donjon caché, nul besoin de réveiller ce qui y gît.
TEXT.German: Lasst es verborgen bleiben, es ist nicht nötig unbekannte Mächte zu wecken, die darin versteckt sein mögen.
TEXT.Italian: Let it remain hidden, there is no need to awaken whatever lies within it.
TEXT.Spanish: Let it remain hidden, there is no need to awaken whatever lies within it.

TEXT.English: Two schools of thought have grown prominent in %s2_city. One advises our contemplation be focused on the prosperity of our people, the other on discovering our eternal truths. Which do you sanction?
TEXT.French: Deux écoles de pensée ont pris de l'ampleur à %s2_city. L'une conseille de se concentrer sur la prospérité de notre peuple, et l'autre de se concentrer sur la recherche des vérités absolues. Laquelle a votre préférence ?
TEXT.German: Zwei Denkschulen haben sich in der Stadt %s2_city herausgebildet. Eine schlägt vor sich auf das Gedeihen unseres Volks zu konzentrieren, die andere befürwortet die Entdeckung ewiger Wahrheiten. Welche billigt Ihr?
TEXT.Italian: Two schools of thought have grown prominent in %s2_city. One advises our contemplation be focused on the prosperity of our people, the other on discovering our eternal truths. Which do you sanction?
TEXT.Spanish: Dos escuelas de renombre han crecido prominentemente en %s2_city. Una aconseja que nos concentremos en la prosperidad de nuestro pueblo, la otra en descubrir nuestras verdades eternas. ¿A cuál aprobamos?

TEXT.English: Have our elders determine ways to improve the lot of our people.
TEXT.French: Que nos anciens trouvent des voies d'amélioration pour notre peuple.
TEXT.German: Lasst unsere Ältesten Wege finden, wie man das Wohl unseres Volkes verbessern kann.
TEXT.Italian: Have our elders determine ways to improve the lot of our people.
TEXT.Spanish: Que nuestros ancianos determinen formas de mejorar el bienestar de nuestro pueblo.

TEXT.English: Wealth is fleeting, while philosophy gives eternal benefits.
TEXT.French: Les richesses sont éphémères, alors que les gains de la philosophie sont éternels.
TEXT.German: Reichtum ist flüchtig, doch Philosophie währt ewig.
TEXT.Italian: Wealth is fleeting, while philosophy gives eternal benefits.
TEXT.Spanish: La prosperidad es pasajera, mientras que la filosofía da beneficios eternos.

TEXT.English: Neither, it is the debate itself that is the most advantageous.
TEXT.French: Aucune des deux. C'est le débat lui-même qui nous apportera le plus.
TEXT.German: Weder noch, die Debatte selbst ist das Wichtigste.
TEXT.Italian: Neither, it is the debate itself that is the most advantageous.
TEXT.Spanish: Ninguna, es el propio debate lo más ventajoso.

TEXT.English: The Elohim have invited our ritualists to participate in their hallowing ritual.
TEXT.French: Les élohions ont invité nos ritualistes à leur rituel de sanctification.
TEXT.German: Die Elohim haben unsere Ritualisten dazu eingeladen, an deren Reinigungsritus teilzunehmen.
TEXT.Italian: The Elohim have invited our ritualists to participate in their hallowing ritual.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Elohim han invitado a nuestros ritualistas a participar en su ritual de santificación.

TEXT.English: We would all benefit from the cleansing of the world, send out ritualists.
TEXT.French: Nous profiterons tous de la purification du monde. Envoyez les ritualistes.
TEXT.German: Die Reinigung der Welt würde uns allen helfen. Schickt unsere Leute zum Ritual.
TEXT.Italian: We would all benefit from the cleansing of the world, send out ritualists.
TEXT.Spanish: Todos nos beneficiaríamos de la purificación del mundo, enviad a nuestros ritualistas.

TEXT.English: This world will be saved by blood and swords, not chanting and incense. Ignore the invitation.
TEXT.French: Ce monde sera sauvé par le sang et et les lames, pas par les chants et l'encens. Déclinez l'invitation.
TEXT.German: Diese Welt wird durch Blut und Schwerter gerettet, nicht durch Gesänge und Weihrauch. Ignoriert die Einladung.
TEXT.Italian: This world will be saved by blood and swords, not chanting and incense. Ignore the invitation.
TEXT.Spanish: Este mundo será salvado con sangre y espadas, no con cánticos e incienso. Ignorad la invitación.

TEXT.English: Send the ritualists, but order them to disrupt the ritual.
TEXT.French: Envoyez les ritualistes mais avez l'ordre d'interrompre le rituel.
TEXT.German: Schickt die Ritualisten, aber befehlt ihnen, das Ritual zu sabotieren.
TEXT.Italian: Send the ritualists, but order them to disrupt the ritual.
TEXT.Spanish: Enviad a los ritualistas, pero ordenadles desbaratar el ritual.

TEXT.English: A traveling enchanter has offer to enchant the weapons of our unit.
TEXT.French: Un enchanteur itinérant a offert d'enchanter les armes de notre unité.
TEXT.German: Ein reisender Zauberer bietet an, die Waffen unserer Einheit zu verzaubern.
TEXT.Italian: A traveling enchanter has offer to enchant the weapons of our unit.
TEXT.Spanish: Un Encantador viajero ofrece encantar las armas de nuestra unidad.

TEXT.English: No, we can't afford it.
TEXT.French: Non, nous ne pouvons nous le permettre.
TEXT.German: Nein, wir können uns das nicht leisten
TEXT.Italian: No, we can't afford it.
TEXT.Spanish: No, no nos lo podemos permitir.

TEXT.English: Yes, this will improve our chances in battle.
TEXT.French: Oui, cela améliorera nos chances au combat.
TEXT.German: Ja, das wird unsere Chancen im Kampf verbessern.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, this will improve our chances in battle.
TEXT.Spanish: Sí, esto aumentará nuestras probabilidades en combate.

TEXT.English: Hire the enchanter to join our army.
TEXT.French: Engager l'enchanteur dans l'armée.
TEXT.German: Heuert den Zauberer für unsere Armee an.
TEXT.Italian: Hire the enchanter to join our army.
TEXT.Spanish: Contratáis al Encantador para unirse a nuestro ejército.

TEXT.English: Neith clan will never tolerate an outsider joining us, but they seem open to teaching us some of the secrets of enchanting.
TEXT.French: Neith clan will never tolerate an outsider joining us, but they seem open to teaching us some of the secrets of enchanting.
TEXT.German: Neith clan will never tolerate an outsider joining us, but they seem open to teaching us some of the secrets of enchanting.
TEXT.Italian: Neith clan will never tolerate an outsider joining us, but they seem open to teaching us some of the secrets of enchanting.
TEXT.Spanish: Neith clan will never tolerate an outsider joining us, but they seem open to teaching us some of the secrets of enchanting.

TEXT.English: A bandit company outside of the %s1_civ city of %s2_city survives by raiding occasional caravans. If we were able to provide some financing they could harass our neighbors' guards.
TEXT.French: Un groupe de bandits installé à l'extérieur de la ville %s1_civ de %s2_city survit en pillant à l'occasion des caravanes. Si nous pouvions leur fournir un appui financier ils pourraient harasser les gardes de nos voisins.
TEXT.German: Ein Ganovenbande außerhalb der %[s1_civ]en Stadt %s2_city schlägt sich gelengentlichen Karawanenüberfällen durch. Wenn wir ihnen etwas Gold gäben, würden sie ihre Angriffe auf unsere Nachbarn konzentrieren.
TEXT.Italian: A bandit company outside of the %s1_civ city of %s2_city survives by raiding occasional caravans. If we were able to provide some financing they could harass our neighbors' guards.
TEXT.Spanish: A bandit company outside of the %s1_civ city of %s2_city survives by raiding occasional caravans. If we were able to provide some financing they could harass our neighbors' guards.

TEXT.English: We will not waste our money on these parasites.
TEXT.French: Nous ne gaspillerons pas notre argent avec ces parasites.
TEXT.German: Wir werden doch unser Gold nicht an diese Parasiten verschwenden.
TEXT.Italian: We will not waste our money on these parasites.
TEXT.Spanish: We will not waste our money on these parasites.

TEXT.English: Fine, send them the money they are requesting.
TEXT.French: Bien, fournissez leur l'argent dont ils ont besoin.
TEXT.German: Gut, gebt ihnen das Gold, das sie fordern.
TEXT.Italian: Fine, send them the money they are requesting.
TEXT.Spanish: Fine, send them the money they are requesting.

TEXT.English: If a little money makes them a threat, what will a lot of money make them?
TEXT.French: Si un peu d'argent les rend dangereux, que deviendraient-ils avec beaucoup d'argent ?
TEXT.German: Wenn sie ein wenig Gold schon zu einer Bedrohung macht, was werden sie dann sein, wenn sie viel Gold bekommen?
TEXT.Italian: If a little money makes them a threat, what will a lot of money make them?
TEXT.Spanish: If a little money makes them a threat, what will a lot of money make them?

TEXT.English: There is an entrance to a deeper level beneath the lair. If there are greater enemies or rewards, they lie within the lair's depths. Do you want to send your unit down?
TEXT.French: On vient de découvrir un accès vers un niveau plus profond du donjon. S'il existe des ennemis plus dangereux ou des butins plus grands, ils se trouvent dans les profondeurs du donjon. Voulez-vous y envoyer votre unité ?
TEXT.German: Es gibt einen Eingang zu tiefer liegenden Ebenen. Wenn es hier mächtigere Feinde oder größere Belohnungen gibt, dann liegen sie in diesen Tiefen. Wollt Ihr Eure Einheit tiefer hinunter schicken?
TEXT.Italian: There is an entrance to a deeper level beneath the lair. If there are greater enemies or rewards, they lie within the lair's depths. Do you want to send your unit down?
TEXT.Spanish: There is an entrance to a deeper level beneath the lair. If there are greater enemies or rewards, they lie within the lair's depths. Do you want to send your unit down?

TEXT.English: Fortune favors the bold, explore the depths.
TEXT.French: La chance sourit aux audacieux. Explorez les profondeurs.
TEXT.German: Das Glück belohnt den Mutigen, also erkundet die Tiefen.
TEXT.Italian: Fortune favors the bold, explore the depths.
TEXT.Spanish: Fortune favors the bold, explore the depths.

TEXT.English: Do not awaken what lies beneath, collapse the dungeon entrance.
TEXT.French: Ne réveillez pas ce qui gît dans les profondeurs. Condamnez l'entrée du donjon.
TEXT.German: Weckt nichts auf was dort unten liegt, bringt den Eingang zum Einsturz.
TEXT.Italian: Do not awaken what lies beneath, collapse the dungeon entrance.
TEXT.Spanish: Do not awaken what lies beneath, collapse the dungeon entrance.

TEXT.English: A group of dwarves mined into tunnels inhabited by lizardmen. They are now openly fighting, every room is a barracks, every hallway a battlefield. Will you take part in the battle?
TEXT.French: Un groupe de mineurs nains a débouché sur des tunnels habités par des sauriens. Ils se livrent aujourd'hui une guerre ouverte. Chaque pièce est une caserne, chaque couloir un champ de batille. Prendrez-vous part au combat ?
TEXT.German: Eine Gruppe von Zwergen hat sich zu Tunnel vorgegraben, die von Echsenwesen bewohnt werden. Sie bekämpfen sich nun dort, jeder Raum ist eine Kaserne, jeder Gang ein Schlachtfeld. Wollt Ihr an diesem Gefecht teilnehmen?
TEXT.Italian: A group of dwarves mined into tunnels inhabited by lizardmen. They are now openly fighting, every room is a barracks, every hallway a battlefield. Will you take part in the battle?
TEXT.Spanish: A group of dwarves mined into tunnels inhabited by lizardmen. They are now openly fighting, every room is a barracks, every hallway a battlefield. Will you take part in the battle?

TEXT.English: Throw our support behind the dwarves, help them clear out the tunnels.
TEXT.French: Aidons les nains à nettoyer les tunnels.
TEXT.German: Unterstützt die Zwerge mit unseren Truppen. Lasst sie die Tunnel freikämpfen.
TEXT.Italian: Throw our support behind the dwarves, help them clear out the tunnels.
TEXT.Spanish: Throw our support behind the dwarves, help them clear out the tunnels.

TEXT.English: Support the lizardmen against the invading dwarves.
TEXT.French: Aidons les sauriens à repousser les envahisseurs nains.
TEXT.German: Unterstützt die Echsenmänner gegen die Zwergeninvasoren.
TEXT.Italian: Support the lizardmen against the invading dwarves.
TEXT.Spanish: Support the lizardmen against the invading dwarves.

TEXT.English: Leave them to their war, we want no part.
TEXT.French: Laissez les se battre, nous ne prendrons pas parti.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie doch ihren Krieg kämpfen, wir nehmen nicht daran teil.
TEXT.Italian: Leave them to their war, we want no part.
TEXT.Spanish: Leave them to their war, we want no part.

TEXT.English: Within the lair you discover a glowing portal. Do you want your unit to pass through?
TEXT.French: Dans le donjon, vous découvrez un portail brillant. Voulez-vous que votre unité le traverse ?
TEXT.German: Auf dieser Ebene findet Ihr ein hell leuchtendes Portal. Sollen es Eure Männer durchschreiten?
TEXT.Italian: Within the lair you discover a glowing portal. Do you want your unit to pass through?
TEXT.Spanish: Within the lair you discover a glowing portal. Do you want your unit to pass through?

TEXT.English: Yes, let's find out what is on the other side.
TEXT.French: Oui, découvrons ce qu'il y a de l'autre côté.
TEXT.German: Ja, lasst uns herausfinden, was auf der anderen Seite ist.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, let's find out what is on the other side.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, let's find out what is on the other side.

TEXT.English: No, continue the exploration but leave the portal alone.
TEXT.French: Non, continuons d'explorer mais laissons le portail de côté.
TEXT.German: Nein, setzt die Erkundung fort, aber lasst dieses Portal dabei aus.
TEXT.Italian: No, continue the exploration but leave the portal alone.
TEXT.Spanish: No, continue the exploration but leave the portal alone.

TEXT.English: Have the local thieves' guild negotiate a split of the bandits' profits.
TEXT.French: Laissez la guilde des voleurs locale négocier une part du butin des bandits.
TEXT.German: Lasst die lokale Diebesgilde einen Anteil an den Profiten der Banditen aushandeln.
TEXT.Italian: Have the local thieves' guild negotiate a split of the bandits' profits.
TEXT.Spanish: Have the local thieves' guild negotiate a split of the bandits' profits.

TEXT.English: An innovative local farmer has developed advanced irrigation techniques and pest control. His annual yields have repeatedly been found to top all other local farmers'.
TEXT.French: Un fermier innovant a développé des techniques avancées d'irrigation et de contrôle de la peste. Les récoltes sont à chaque fois meilleures que celles des autres fermiers du coin.
TEXT.German: Ein erfinderischer, örtlicher Bauer hat fortschrittliche Techniken zur Bewässerung und zur Schädlingsbekämpfung entwickelt. Seine jährlichen Erträge haben wiederholt jene der anderen örtlichen Bauern übertroffen.
TEXT.Italian: An innovative local farmer has developed advanced irrigation techniques and pest control. His annual yields have repeatedly been found to top all other local farmers'.
TEXT.Spanish: An innovative local farmer has developed advanced irrigation techniques and pest control. His annual yields have repeatedly been found to top all other local farmers'.

TEXT.English: Have the farmer send his extra produce to the city.
TEXT.French: Que le fermier envoie ses excédents à la ville.
TEXT.German: Lasst den Bauern seine zusätzlichen Erträge in die Stadt liefern.
TEXT.Italian: Have the farmer send his extra produce to the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Have the farmer send his extra produce to the city.

TEXT.English: Have the farmer sell his extra produce.
TEXT.French: Laissez le fermier vendre ses excédents.
TEXT.German: Lasst den Bauern seine zusätzlichen Erträge verkaufen.
TEXT.Italian: Have the farmer sell his extra produce.
TEXT.Spanish: Have the farmer sell his extra produce.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of a dimensional node. It flared up, pulling a unit through into our lands.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud dimensionnel. Il s'est activé, amenant une unité sur nos terres.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Dimensionsmagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und zog eine Einheit in unsere Lande.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of a dimensional node. It flared up, pulling a unit through into our lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo dimensional. Estalló, empujando una unidad a través de él hacia nuestras tierras.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of an entropy node. It flared up, spoiling the surrounding area.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud d'entropie. Il s'est activé, dégradant les alentours.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Entropiemagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und besudelte die Umgebung.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of an entropy node. It flared up, spoiling the surrounding area.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo de entropía. Estalló, destruyendo el área circundante.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of a fire node. It flared up, starting fires in the surrounding area.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud de feu. Il s'est activé, déclenchant des incendies aux alentours.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Feuermagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und löste Brände in der Umgebung aus.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of a fire node. It flared up, starting fires in the surrounding area.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo de fuego. Estalló, empezando incendios en el área circundante.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of a life node. It flared up, healing the surrounding area.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud de vie. Il s'est activé, soignant les alentours.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Lebensmagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und heilte Einheiten in der Umgebung.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of a life node. It flared up, healing the surrounding area.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo de vida. Estalló, curando el área circundante.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of a nature node. It flared up, causing plants to bloom in the surrounding area.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud de nature. Il s'est activé, causant une croissance frénétique des plantes aux alentours.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Naturmagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und löste eine plötzliche Blüte in der Umgebung aus.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of a nature node. It flared up, causing plants to bloom in the surrounding area.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo de naturaleza. Estalló, haciendo que las plantas crecieran vertiginosamente en el área circundante.

TEXT.English: Our channelers have lost control of a water node. It flared up, altering the weather in the surrounding area.
TEXT.French: Nos canaliseurs ont perdu le contrôle d'un nœud d'eau. Il s'est activé, modifiant le climat aux alentours.
TEXT.German: Unsere Magier haben die Kontrolle über einen Manabrunnen der Wassermagie verloren. Magie strömte aus und veränderte das Wetter der Umgebung.
TEXT.Italian: Our channelers have lost control of a water node. It flared up, altering the weather in the surrounding area.
TEXT.Spanish: Nuestros canalizadores han perdido el control de un nodo de agua. Estalló, alterando el clima del área circundante.

TEXT.English: Your unit has eaten something that doesn't agree with him. He will be unable to travel until the sickness passes.
TEXT.French: Votre unité a mangé quelque chose qui ne lui convient pas. Elle sera incapable de voyager tant qu'elle n'aura pas guéri.
TEXT.German: Eure Einheit hat etwas gegessen, das ihr nicht bekommt. Sie wird nicht weiterreisen können, bis die Übelkeit vorbei ist.
TEXT.Italian: Your unit has eaten something that doesn't agree with him. He will be unable to travel until the sickness passes.
TEXT.Spanish: Your unit has eaten something that doesn't agree with him. He will be unable to travel until the sickness passes.

TEXT.English: Your unit has encountered a village on the verge of hysteria. Rumour has it that werewolves are preying upon the villagers.
TEXT.French: Votre unité a découvert un village au bord de l'hystérie. Une rumeur court sur des loups-garous s'attaquant aux villageois.
TEXT.German: Eure Einheit ist auf ein Dorf gestoßen, das sich an der Grenze zur Hysterie befindet. Gerüchten zufolge machen Werwölfe Jagd auf die Dorfbewohner.
TEXT.Italian: Your unit has encountered a village on the verge of hysteria. Rumour has it that werewolves are preying upon the villagers.
TEXT.Spanish: Your unit has encountered a village on the verge of hysteria. Rumour has it that werewolves are preying upon the villagers.

TEXT.English: We must uncover these creatures and save the village.
TEXT.French: Nous devons découvrir ces créatures et sauver le village.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen diese Kreaturen aufspüren und das Dorf retten.
TEXT.Italian: We must uncover these creatures and save the village.
TEXT.Spanish: We must uncover these creatures and save the village.

TEXT.English: Werewolves could be powerful allies, try to strike a bargain.
TEXT.French: Les loups-garous pourraient être de puissants alliés, essayez de conclure un marché.
TEXT.German: Werwölfe können mächtige Verbündete sein. Versucht, einen Handel abzuschließen.
TEXT.Italian: Werewolves could be powerful allies, try to strike a bargain.
TEXT.Spanish: Werewolves could be powerful allies, try to strike a bargain.

TEXT.English: We have no time to involve ourselves in village gossip.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas le temps de nous occuper des ragots du village.
TEXT.German: Wir haben keine Zeit, uns in den Dorfklatsch verwickeln zu lassen..
TEXT.Italian: We have no time to involve ourselves in village gossip.
TEXT.Spanish: We have no time to involve ourselves in village gossip.

TEXT.English: (Lynched by villagers)
TEXT.French: (Lynché par les villageois)
TEXT.German: (gelyncht von der Stadtbevölkerung)
TEXT.Italian: (Lynched by villagers)
TEXT.Spanish: (Lynched by villagers)

TEXT.English: (Slain by werewolves)
TEXT.French: (Tué par les loups-garous)
TEXT.German: (erschlagen von Werwölfen)
TEXT.Italian: (Slain by werewolves)
TEXT.Spanish: (Slain by werewolves)

TEXT.English: Your unit has been lynched by the villagers.
TEXT.French: Votre unité a été lynchée par les villageois.
TEXT.German: Eure Einheit wurde von der Stadtbevölkerung gelyncht.
TEXT.Italian: Your unit has been lynched by the villagers.
TEXT.Spanish: Your unit has been lynched by the villagers.

TEXT.English: Your unit has been killed by the werewolves.
TEXT.French: Votre unité a été tuée par les loups-garous.
TEXT.German: Eure Einheit wurde von den Werwölfen getötet.
TEXT.Italian: Your unit has been killed by the werewolves.
TEXT.Spanish: Your unit has been killed by the werewolves.

TEXT.English: Frostlings have been spotted playing on the cold wastes around your cities.
TEXT.French: Des Gelbiontes ont été aperçus jouant sur les terres glacées de vos villes.
TEXT.German: Frostlinge wurden gesehen, wie sie in den eisigen Ödlanden nahe Eurer Städte spielten.
TEXT.Italian: Frostlings have been spotted playing on the cold wastes around your cities.
TEXT.Spanish: Se han visto frostlings jugando en los páramos helados alrededor de nuestras ciudades.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 to the Armageddon Counter
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 au Compteur Armageddon
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 zum Armageddonzähler
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 to the Armageddon Counter
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]%D1 al Contador del Armagedón

TEXT.English: Muris Clan goblins are dumping their waste in your lands. Your men chase them off, but not before they have poisoned the area.
TEXT.French: Les Gobelins du Clan Muris se débarassent de leurs déchêts sur vos terres. Vos hommes les ont chassés, mais pas avant qu'ils aient empoisonné la zone.
TEXT.German: Die Goblins des Murisklans laden ihren Abfall in Euren Ländereien ab. Eure Männer haben sie verjagt, aber sie konnten die Verseuchung des Gebiets nicht verhindern.
TEXT.Italian: Muris Clan goblins are dumping their waste in your lands. Your men chase them off, but not before they have poisoned the area.
TEXT.Spanish: Muris Clan goblins are dumping their waste in your lands. Your men chase them off, but not before they have poisoned the area.

TEXT.English: There is nothing we can do about it.
TEXT.French: Il n'y a rien que l'on puisse y faire.
TEXT.German: Wir können daran leider nichts ändern.
TEXT.Italian: There is nothing we can do about it.
TEXT.Spanish: There is nothing we can do about it.

TEXT.English: Send an adept who is proficient in nature magic to heal the damage.
TEXT.French: Envoyez un adepte spécialisé dans la magie de la nature pour soigner les dommages.
TEXT.German: Schickt einen Adepten, der die Naturmagie beherrscht, um den angerichteten Schaden zu beheben.
TEXT.Italian: Send an adept who is proficient in nature magic to heal the damage.
TEXT.Spanish: Send an adept who is proficient in nature magic to heal the damage.

TEXT.English: Stories of the God of Winter reborn are spreading through our people. Can even the most powerful army defeat a god? You are deep in thought on this when a man in crimson robes approaches your throne. You are surprised to see him walk past your guards but they, and the rest of the throne room, seem somehow grey and distant to you. Only the man seems real.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you?" you ask.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"An old man. I've come to warn you about Auric and his ascension. There is a sword, made to enforce the Compact that may help."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He hands you a map and turns to leave.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I've heard of the sword," you yell after him, "will it work on a man with a god's power?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I certainly hope so."
TEXT.French: Des histoires à propos de la renaissance du Dieu de l'Hiver se répandent à travers votre peuple. Même la plus puissante des armées a-t-elle une chance de vaincre un dieu ? Vous étiez en train d'y réfléchir intensément quand un homme vêtu d'une robe écarlate s'est approché du trône. Vous êtes surpris de le voir dépasser tranquillement vos gardes puis réalisez que vos gardes et le reste de la salle du trône vous semblent gris et distants. Seul l'homme semble réel.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Qui êtes-vous ?" demandez-vous.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Un vieil homme. Je suis venu vous mettre en garde contre Auric et son ascension. Il existe une épée, faite pour renforcer la Convention et qui pourrait aider."[PARAGRAPH:1]Il vous tend une carte et s'apprête à partir.[PARAGRAPH:1]"J'ai entendu parler de l'épée," lui criez-vous, "fonctionnera-t-elle contre un homme doté des pouvoirs d'un dieu ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Je l'espère."
TEXT.German: Geschichten über den wiedergeborenen Gott des Winters verbreiten sich unter Eurem Volk. Kann selbst das stärkste Heer einen Gott besiegen? Ihr seid tief in Gedanken versunken ob dieser Frage, als sich ein Mann in scharlachroter Robe Eurem Thron nähert. Ihr seid überrascht zu sehen, dass er, ohne Gegenwehr, durch die Reihen Eurer Wachen schreitet. Euer Thronsaal und die Wachen wirken jedoch irgendwie grau und entfernt auf Euch. Nur dieser Mann erscheint wirklich.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Wer seid Ihr?", fragt Ihr.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ein alter Mann. Ich bin gekommen, um Euch vor Auric und seinem Aufstieg zu warnen. Es gibt ein Schwert, geschmiedet um den Pakt zu gewährleisten, welches Euch nun nützlich sein kann.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Er händigt Euch eine Karte aus und geht von dannen.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ihr ruft ihm hinterher: "Ich hörte von diesem Schwert. Wird es auch bei ein Mann mit göttlichen Kräften wirken?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Ich hoffe es doch."
TEXT.Italian: Stories of the God of Winter reborn are spreading through our people. Can even the most powerful army defeat a god? You are deep in thought on this when a man in crimson robes approaches your throne. You are surprised to see him walk past your guards but they, and the rest of the throne room, seem somehow grey and distant to you. Only the man seems real.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you?" you ask.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"An old man. I've come to warn you about Auric and his ascension. There is a sword, made to enforce the Compact that may help."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He hands you a map and turns to leave.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I've heard of the sword," you yell after him, "will it work on a man with a god's power?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I certainly hope so."
TEXT.Spanish: Stories of the God of Winter reborn are spreading through our people. Can even the most powerful army defeat a god? You are deep in thought on this when a man in crimson robes approaches your throne. You are surprised to see him walk past your guards but they, and the rest of the throne room, seem somehow grey and distant to you. Only the man seems real.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"Who are you?" you ask.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"An old man. I've come to warn you about Auric and his ascension. There is a sword, made to enforce the Compact that may help."[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]He hands you a map and turns to leave.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I've heard of the sword," you yell after him, "will it work on a man with a god's power?"[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]"I certainly hope so."

Il existe une épée, faite pour renforcer la Convention et qui pourrait aider."[PARAGRAPH:1]Il vous tend une carte et s'apprête à partir.[PARAGRAPH:1]"J'ai entendu parler de l'épée," lui criez-vous, "fonctionnera-t-elle contre un ange doté des pouvoirs d'un dieu ?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Je l'espère."

Ihr seid überrascht zu sehen, dass er, ohne Gegenwehr, durch die Reihen Eurer Wachen schreitet. Euer Thronsaal und die Wachen wirken jedoch irgendwie grau und entfernt auf Euch. TEXT.English: The governor of %s2_city has been assassinated. The assassin also tried to kill the governor's 12 year old son. Fortunately the house gardener got the boy out of the house and hid him on the grounds until the assassin was caught and the guards had the estate back under control. Who should we appoint to lead the city?
TEXT.French: Le gouverneur de %s2_city a été assassiné. L'assassin a également tenté de tuer le fils de 12 ans du gouverneur. Heureusement le jardinier a fait évacuer l'enfant et l'a caché dans le jardin jusqu'à ce que l'assassin soit pris et la situation de retour sous le contrôle des gardes. Qui devrions-nous nommer à la tête de la ville ?
TEXT.German: Der Bürgermeister der Stadt %s2_city ist einem Anschlag zum Opfer gefallen. Der Attentäter versuchte auch, den 12-jährigen Sohn des Bürgermeisters zu töten. Glücklicherweise konnte der Gärtner den Jungen aus dem Haus retten und ihn im weitläufigen Garten verstecken, bis der Attentäter überwältigt wurde und die Wachen das Anwesen wieder unter Kontrolle hatten. Wem sollen wir nun die Führung der Stadt übertragen?
TEXT.Italian: The governor of %s2_city has been assassinated. The assassin also tried to kill the governor's 12 year old son. Fortunately the house gardener got the boy out of the house and hid him on the grounds until the assassin was caught and the guards had the estate back under control. Who should we appoint to lead the city?
TEXT.Spanish: The governor of %s2_city has been assassinated. The assassin also tried to kill the governor's 12 year old son. Fortunately the house gardener got the boy out of the house and hid him on the grounds until the assassin was caught and the guards had the estate back under control. Who should we appoint to lead the city?

TEXT.English: The boy should take up his father's position.
TEXT.French: L'enfant devrait succéder à la place de son père.
TEXT.German: Der Junge soll die Position seines Vaters einnehmen.
TEXT.Italian: The boy should take up his father's position.
TEXT.Spanish: The boy should take up his father's position.

TEXT.English: The gardener showed cunning and bravery in his protection of the boy, I will make him the city's new governor.
TEXT.French: Le jardinier a fait preuve d'astuce et de courage en protégeant l'enfant. Je ferai de lui le nouveau gouverneur.
TEXT.German: Der Gärtner bewies List und Tapferkeit, als er den Jungen beschützte. Er soll der neue Bürgermeister der Stadt werden.
TEXT.Italian: The gardener showed cunning and bravery in his protection of the boy, I will make him the city's new governor.
TEXT.Spanish: The gardener showed cunning and bravery in his protection of the boy, I will make him the city's new governor.

TEXT.English: Allow the people of the city to elect their own governor.
TEXT.French: Organisez des élections pour que le peuple élise son nouveau gouverneur.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt der Bevölkerung der Stadt, ihren nächsten Bürgermeister selbst zu bestimmen.
TEXT.Italian: Allow the people of the city to elect their own governor.
TEXT.Spanish: Allow the people of the city to elect their own governor.

TEXT.English: Allow the church to decide who should lead the city.
TEXT.French: Laissez l'église choisir qui devrait régir la ville.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt der Kirche zu bestimmen, wer die Führung der Stadt übernehmen soll.
TEXT.Italian: Allow the church to decide who should lead the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Allow the church to decide who should lead the city.

TEXT.English: The citizens of %s2_city complain that disease has killed so many that they have no place to bury the bodies.
TEXT.French: Les habitants de %s2_city se plaignent d'une maladie tellement mortelle qu'ils n'ont plus de place pour enterrer les corps.
TEXT.German: Die Bewohner der Stadt %s2_city beklagen sich darüber, dass die Seuche soviele getötet hat, dass die Leichen nirgendwo mehr begraben werden können.
TEXT.Italian: The citizens of %s2_city complain that disease has killed so many that they have no place to bury the bodies.
TEXT.Spanish: Los ciudadanos de %s2_city denuncian que la enfermedad ha matado a tantos que ya no tienen un lugar donde enterrar los cuerpos.

TEXT.English: Finance the building of a graveyard outside of the city.
TEXT.French: Financez la construction d'un cimetière à l'extérieur de la ville.
TEXT.German: Stellt Mittel für die Errichtung eines Friedhofs außerhalb der Stadt bereit.
TEXT.Italian: Finance the building of a graveyard outside of the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Financiad la construcción de un cementerio fuera de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: There is nothing I can do.
TEXT.French: Il n'y a rien que je puisse faire.
TEXT.German: Ich kann leider nichts für sie tun.
TEXT.Italian: There is nothing I can do.
TEXT.Spanish: No hay nada que pueda hacer.

TEXT.English: Build a pyre in the city square, then raise the corpses placed in it.
TEXT.French: Construisez un bûcher sur la grand place et mettez-y les corps.
TEXT.German: Errichtet einen Scheiterhaufen auf dem Stadtplatz und werft die Leichen hinein.
TEXT.Italian: Build a pyre in the city square, then raise the corpses placed in it.
TEXT.Spanish: Construid una Pira en la plaza de la ciudad, después alzad los cuerpos emplazados en ella.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of one of its members.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services de l'un de ses membres.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste eines ihrer Mitglieder an.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of one of its members.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de uno de sus miembros.

TEXT.English: A unit already trained in the magical arts would be useful.
TEXT.French: Une unité déjà entrainée dans les arts magiques serait utile.
TEXT.German: Eine erfahrene, magisch begabte Einheit wäre nützlich.
TEXT.Italian: A unit already trained in the magical arts would be useful.
TEXT.Spanish: Una unidad ya entrenada en las artes mágicas sería útil.

TEXT.English: A few units trained in archery could come in handy for city defense.
TEXT.French: Quelques unités entrainées en archerie viendraient à point nommé pour la défense de la ville.
TEXT.German: Ein paar Einheiten, die mit dem Bogen umgehen können, wären hilfreich für die Stadtverteidigung.
TEXT.Italian: A few units trained in archery could come in handy for city defense.
TEXT.Spanish: Unas pocas unidades entrenadas en la arquería vendrían muy bien para la defensa de la ciudad.

TEXT.English: A Hunter would be useful to explore the surrounding lands.
TEXT.French: Un Chasseur serait utile pour explorer les terres environnantes.
TEXT.German: Ein Jäger wäre nützlich, um die umliegenden Länder zu erforschen.
TEXT.Italian: A Hunter would be useful to explore the surrounding lands.
TEXT.Spanish: Un cazador sería útil para explorar las tierras de alrededor.

TEXT.English: A Horse Archer would allow me to strike quickly at my enemies.
TEXT.French: Un Archer Monté me permettrait de frapper prestement mes ennemis.
TEXT.German: Ein Berittener Bogenschütze würde mir schnelle Attacken auf meine Feinde ermöglichen.
TEXT.Italian: A Horse Archer would allow me to strike quickly at my enemies.
TEXT.Spanish: Un Arquero a Caballo me permitiría atacar con rapidez a mis enemigos.

TEXT.English: A Champion would strengthen my army.
TEXT.French: Un Champion renforcerait mon armée.
TEXT.German: Ein Champion würde meiner Armee gut tun.
TEXT.Italian: A Champion would strengthen my army.
TEXT.Spanish: Un campeón reforzaría mi ejército.

TEXT.English: An Assassin would let me deal with my problems discreetly.
TEXT.French: Un Assassin Me permettrait de régler mes problèmes discrètement.
TEXT.German: Ein Meuchelmörder könnte meine Probleme diskret lösen.
TEXT.Italian: An Assassin would let me deal with my problems discreetly.
TEXT.Spanish: Un asesino me permitiría encargarme de los problemas discretamente.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a band of defectors from the elven war, tired of fighting their own kin. An elven Mercenary, Ranger and Assassin.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services d'un groupe de déserteurs des guerres elfes, fatigués de se battre contre leur race : un Mercenaire, un Rôdeur et un Assassin Elfes.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste einer Bande von elfischen Abtrünnigen an, die es leid sind, gegen ihre eigenen Brüder zu kämpfen. Sie besteht aus einem elfischen Söldner, einem elfischen Waldläufer und einem elfischen Meuchelmörder.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a band of defectors from the elven war, tired of fighting their own kin. An elven Mercenary, Ranger and Assassin.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de una banda de desertores de la guerra élfica, cansados de luchar contra los suyos. Un mercenario elfo, montaraz y asesino.

TEXT.English: We welcome their talents.
TEXT.French: Nous ferons bon usage de leurs talents.
TEXT.German: Wir empfangen ihre Talente mit offenen Armen.
TEXT.Italian: We welcome their talents.
TEXT.Spanish: Damos la bienvenida a sus talentos.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a pirate crew looking for the chance to plunder. A Mercenary, Boarding Party and a Privateer ship.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services d'un équipage pirate à la recherche de pillages : un Mercenaire, une Escouade d'Abordage et un navire Corsaire.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste einer Piratenbesatzung an, die auf der Suche nach neuer Beute ist. Sie besteht aus einem Söldner, einer Entermannschaft und einem Korsar.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a pirate crew looking for the chance to plunder. A Mercenary, Boarding Party and a Privateer ship.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de una tripulación de piratas que busca la oportunidad de saquear. Un grupo de abordaje mercenario y una nave corsaria.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a Balseraph troupe looking for fun. A Mercenary, Taskmaster and an Acrobat.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services d'une troupe balséraphine cherchant à s'amuser : un Mercenaire, un Contre-Maître et un Acrobate.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste einer Balseraphtruppe an, die nach Spaß sucht. Sie besteht aus einem Söldner, einem Knechtmeister und einem Akrobaten.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a Balseraph troupe looking for fun. A Mercenary, Taskmaster and an Acrobat.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de una troupe (compañía de teatro) Balseraph que busca diversión. Un mercenario, un esclavista y un acróbata.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a group of dwarven engineers. A dwarven Mercenary, dwarven Champion and a dwarven Cannon.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services d'un groupe d'ingénieurs nains : un Mercenaire, un Champion et un Canon nains.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste einer Gruppe zwergischer Ingenieure an. Sie besteht aus einem zwergischen Söldner, einem zwergischen Champion und einer Zwergen-Kartaune.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a group of dwarven engineers. A dwarven Mercenary, dwarven Champion and a dwarven Cannon.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de un grupo de ingenieros Enanos. Un mercenario enano, un campeón enano y un cañón enano.

TEXT.English: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a barbarian gang looking for revenge on their clan. An orc Mercenary, Ogre and a Lizardman.
TEXT.French: La Guilde des Neuf vous propose les services d'un gang de barbares cherchant à venger leur clan : trois Mercenaires, orc, ogre et saurien.
TEXT.German: Die Gilde der Neun bietet Euch - für einen angemessenen Preis - die Dienste einer Barbarenbande an, die ihren Klan rächen wollen. Sie besteht aus einem orkischen Söldner, einem Troll und einem Echsenkrieger.
TEXT.Italian: The Guild of the Nine offers to sell you the services of a barbarian gang looking for revenge on their clan. An orc Mercenary, Ogre and a Lizardman.
TEXT.Spanish: La Cofradía de los Nueve os ofrece venderos los servicios de una banda de bárbaros que busca venganza para su clan. Un mercenario orco, un ogro y un hombre-lagarto.

TEXT.English: Your prophets tell of a child that is destined to be born in the city of %s2_city that will bring peace to the world.
TEXT.French: Vos prophètes vous parlent d'un enfant à naître dans la ville de %s2_city qui apportera la paix dans le monde.
TEXT.German: Unsere Propheten erzählen von einem Kind, das in der Stadt %s2_city geboren wird und dazu bestimmt ist, der Welt Frieden zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Your prophets tell of a child that is destined to be born in the city of %s2_city that will bring peace to the world.
TEXT.Spanish: Vuestros profetas hablan de un niño que está destinado a nacer en la ciudad de %s2_city que traerá la paz al mundo.

TEXT.English: I have no use for vague legends.
TEXT.French: De vagues légendes ne m'intéressent pas.
TEXT.German: Ich habe keine Verwendung für vage Legenden.
TEXT.Italian: I have no use for vague legends.
TEXT.Spanish: No puedo darles crédito a las leyendas imprecisas.

TEXT.English: Make sure the city's children have the best care possible.
TEXT.French: Faites en sorte qu'on s'occupe du mieux possible des enfants de la ville.
TEXT.German: Stellt sicher, dass die Kinder der Stadt die bestmögliche Fürsorge erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: Make sure the city's children have the best care possible.
TEXT.Spanish: Aseguraos de que el niño de esa ciudad reciba los mejores cuidados posibles.

TEXT.English: Kill any child born in the city for the next few years.
TEXT.French: Tuez tout enfant qui naîtra dans la ville pour les quelques prochaines années.
TEXT.German: Tötet jedes Kind, das in den nächsten Jahren in dieser Stadt geboren wird.
TEXT.Italian: Kill any child born in the city for the next few years.
TEXT.Spanish: Matad a cualquier niño nacido en la ciudad durante los siguientes pocos años.

TEXT.English: A dreamer will be able to clarify the vision, have them identify the child and allow the Overlords to raise him.
TEXT.French: Un rêveur devrait pouvoir clarifier la vision. Qu'ils identifient l'enfant, et que les Suzerains l'élèvent.
TEXT.German: Ein Träumer wird die Vision verdeutlichen können. Lasst ihn das Kind finden und erlaubt den Schatten der Tiefe, es aufzuziehen.
TEXT.Italian: A dreamer will be able to clarify the vision, have them identify the child and allow the Overlords to raise him.
TEXT.Spanish: Un soñador será capaz de aclarar la visión, haced que identifiquen al niño y dejad que los Supremos lo alcen.

TEXT.English: A successful hunter is offering to sell his catches in the city of %s2_city. Would you like to buy any?
TEXT.French: Un chasseur couronné de succès vend ses prises dans la ville de %s2_city. Voulez-vous en acheter une ?
TEXT.German: Ein erfolgreicher Jäger bietet in der Stadt %s2_city seine gefangenen Tiere an. Möchtet Ihr eines davon kaufen?
TEXT.Italian: A successful hunter is offering to sell his catches in the city of %s2_city. Would you like to buy any?
TEXT.Spanish: Un cazador próspero ofrece vender sus capturas en la ciudad de %s2_city. ¿Os gustaría comprar alguna?

TEXT.English: A Wolf
TEXT.French: Un Loup
TEXT.German: Einen Wolf.
TEXT.Italian: A Wolf
TEXT.Spanish: Un Lobo

TEXT.English: A Lion
TEXT.French: Un Lion
TEXT.German: Einen Löwen.
TEXT.Italian: A Lion
TEXT.Spanish: Un León

TEXT.English: A Gorilla
TEXT.French: Un Gorille
TEXT.German: Einen Gorilla.
TEXT.Italian: A Gorilla
TEXT.Spanish: Un Gorila

TEXT.English: A Tiger
TEXT.French: Un Tigre
TEXT.German: Einen Tiger.
TEXT.Italian: A Tiger
TEXT.Spanish: Un Tigre

TEXT.English: Hire the Hunter
TEXT.French: Engager le Chasseur
TEXT.German: Heuert den Jäger an.
TEXT.Italian: Hire the Hunter
TEXT.Spanish: Contratas al Cazador

TEXT.English: We will not waste money on this
TEXT.French: Nous ne gaspillerons pas notre argent pour cela.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dafür kein Gold verschwenden.
TEXT.Italian: We will not waste money on this
TEXT.Spanish: No gastaremos dinero en esto

TEXT.English: Which city would you like to take control of?
TEXT.French: De quelle ville voulez-vous prendre le contrôle ?
TEXT.German: Welche Stadt möchtet Ihr unter Eure Kontrolle bringen?
TEXT.Italian: Which city would you like to take control of?
TEXT.Spanish: ¿De qué ciudad os gustaría tomar el control?

TEXT.English: City 1
TEXT.French: Ville 1
TEXT.German: Stadt 1
TEXT.Italian: City 1
TEXT.Spanish: Ciudad 1

TEXT.English: City 2
TEXT.French: Ville 2
TEXT.German: Stadt 2
TEXT.Italian: City 2
TEXT.Spanish: Ciudad 2

TEXT.English: City 3
TEXT.French: Ville 3
TEXT.German: Stadt 3
TEXT.Italian: City 3
TEXT.Spanish: Ciudad 3

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Take control of %s1_city
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Prendre le contrôle de %s1_city
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]gewährt die Kontrolle über die Stadt %s1_city
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Take control of %s1_city
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Tomar el control de %s1_city

TEXT.English: Immigrants are requesting sanctuary in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Des immigrants réclament asile dans la ville de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Einwanderer bitten in der Stadt %s2_city um Asyl.
TEXT.Italian: Immigrants are requesting sanctuary in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Immigrants are requesting sanctuary in the city of %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Have them outfitted to build a community of their own.
TEXT.French: Équipez les pour qu'ils se construisent leur propre communauté.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie mit dem Nötigsten ausstatten, damit sie ihre eigene Gemeinde gründen können.
TEXT.Italian: Have them outfitted to build a community of their own.
TEXT.Spanish: Have them outfitted to build a community of their own.

TEXT.English: Train the most talented among them as an Adept.
TEXT.French: Entraînez le plus doué pour en faire un Adepte.
TEXT.German: Bildet die begabtesten unter ihnen zu Adepten aus.
TEXT.Italian: Train the most talented among them as an Adept.
TEXT.Spanish: Train the most talented among them as an Adept.

TEXT.English: Press them into service in the military.
TEXT.French: Poussez les à s'engager dans l'armée.
TEXT.German: Zwingt sie in den Militärdienst.
TEXT.Italian: Press them into service in the military.
TEXT.Spanish: Press them into service in the military.

TEXT.English: Ask them to train in the city's defense as Archers.
TEXT.French: Demandez leur de se joindre aux défenses de la ville comme Archers.
TEXT.German: Fordert sie auf, bei der Stadtverteidigung als Bogenschützen zu helfen.
TEXT.Italian: Ask them to train in the city's defense as Archers.
TEXT.Spanish: Ask them to train in the city's defense as Archers.

TEXT.English: If they have survived the trip they must have learned to hunt in the wild. Have them outfitted as Hunters.
TEXT.French: S'ils ont survécu au voyage ils ont dû apprendre à chasser dans la nature. Équipez les pour en faire des Chasseurs.
TEXT.German: Wenn sie die Reise überlebt haben, müssen sie gelernt haben, in der Wildnis zu jagen. Lasst sie als Jäger ausrüsten.
TEXT.Italian: If they have survived the trip they must have learned to hunt in the wild. Have them outfitted as Hunters.
TEXT.Spanish: If they have survived the trip they must have learned to hunt in the wild. Have them outfitted as Hunters.

TEXT.English: Ask the governor to help them setup housing.
TEXT.French: Demandez au gouverneur de les aider à s'installer.
TEXT.German: Fordert den Bürgermeister auf, sie beim Hausbau zu unterstützen.
TEXT.Italian: Ask the governor to help them setup housing.
TEXT.Spanish: Ask the governor to help them setup housing.

TEXT.English: Immigrants to our lands? It's like a fish that jumps into the net. Have them auctioned off to the noblemen for whatever use they prefer.
TEXT.French: Des immigrants sur nos terres ? On dirait un poisson se jetant dans les filets. Vendez les aux enchères pour que les nobles en disposent à leur guise.
TEXT.German: Einwanderer in unser Land? Das ist wie ein Fisch, der einem direkt ins Netz springt. Lasst sie an die Adligen versteigern, zu welcher Verwendung sie auch immer bevorzugen.
TEXT.Italian: Immigrants to our lands? It's like a fish that jumps into the net. Have them auctioned off to the noblemen for whatever use they prefer.
TEXT.Spanish: Immigrants to our lands? It's like a fish that jumps into the net. Have them auctioned off to the noblemen for whatever use they prefer.

TEXT.English: The people of %s2_city complain of inadequate housing. Travelers in the city have comfortable inn rooms while our people sleep on the streets. They ask that you convert the inn to public housing.
TEXT.French: The people of %s2_city complain of inadequate housing. Travelers in the city have comfortable inn rooms while our people sleep on the streets. They ask that you convert the inn to public housing.
TEXT.German: Die Bewohner der Stadt %s2_city beklagen sich über ihre maroden Unterkünfte. Reisende in der Stadt wohnen im bequemen Gasthaus, während unsere Bürger auf der Straße schlafen. Sie bitten Euch, das Gasthaus zu einer öffentlichen Unterkunft zu erklären.
TEXT.Italian: The people of %s2_city complain of inadequate housing. Travelers in the city have comfortable inn rooms while our people sleep on the streets. They ask that you convert the inn to public housing.
TEXT.Spanish: El pueblo de %s2_city denuncia una inadecuada vivienda. Los viajeros que visitan la ciudad tienen habitaciones de posada confortables mientras que nuestra gente duerme en las calles. Piden que convirtáis la posada en una vivienda pública.

TEXT.English: No, the city will do even worse if we are unable to provide for the merchants that pass through it.
TEXT.French: No, the city will do even worse if we are unable to provide for the merchants that pass through it.
TEXT.German: Nein, der Stadt wird es noch schlechter ergehen, wenn wird wir durchziehende Händler nicht unterbringen können.
TEXT.Italian: No, the city will do even worse if we are unable to provide for the merchants that pass through it.
TEXT.Spanish: No, la ciudad estará incluso peor si somos incapaces de proveer a los mercaderes que pasan por ella.

TEXT.English: Fine, have the inn converted into housing.
TEXT.French: Fine, have the inn converted into housing.
TEXT.German: Gut. Lasst das Gasthaus zu einer Unterkunft umbauen.
TEXT.Italian: Fine, have the inn converted into housing.
TEXT.Spanish: Bien, haced que la posada sea convertida en una vivienda.

TEXT.English: A dwarven merchant offers to sell an artifact from the Underhome, a seamless iron orb. The orb is easily six to seven times heavier than normal and touching it fills your mind with whispers and voices long past. The dwarf claims that long ago Patrian researchers had their souls bound into objects rather than pass into eternity, and this orb is one of those objects.
TEXT.French: A dwarven merchant offers to sell an artifact from the Underhome, a seamless iron orb. The orb is easily six to seven times heavier than normal and touching it fills your mind with whispers and voices long past. The dwarf claims that long ago Patrian researchers had their souls bound into objects rather than pass into eternity, and this orb is one of those objects.
TEXT.German: Ein zwergischer Händler bietet eine Artefakt aus dem Unterreich zum Verkauf an, eine makellose Eisenkugel. Die Kugel ist sechs- bis siebenmal schwerer wie normal, und als Ihr sie berührt, werden Eure Gedanken mit Geflüster und Stimmen aus der Vergangenheit erfüllt. Der Zwerg behauptet, dass vor langer Zeit patrianische Gelehrte ihre Seelen lieber an Gegenstände gebunden haben, als in die Ewigkeit einzugehen, und dass diese Kugel eine dieser Gegenstände ist.
TEXT.Italian: A dwarven merchant offers to sell an artifact from the Underhome, a seamless iron orb. The orb is easily six to seven times heavier than normal and touching it fills your mind with whispers and voices long past. The dwarf claims that long ago Patrian researchers had their souls bound into objects rather than pass into eternity, and this orb is one of those objects.
TEXT.Spanish: A dwarven merchant offers to sell an artifact from the Underhome, a seamless iron orb. The orb is easily six to seven times heavier than normal and touching it fills your mind with whispers and voices long past. The dwarf claims that long ago Patrian researchers had their souls bound into objects rather than pass into eternity, and this orb is one of those objects.

TEXT.English: No, this is obviously necromantic power and we will have no part in it.
TEXT.French: No, this is obviously necromantic power and we will have no part in it.
TEXT.German: Nein, das ist offensichtlich nekromantische Magie und wir wollen nichts damit zu tun haben.
TEXT.Italian: No, this is obviously necromantic power and we will have no part in it.
TEXT.Spanish: No, this is obviously necromantic power and we will have no part in it.

TEXT.English: Yes, buy the orb and have it added to our library so researchers can benefit from its knowledge.
TEXT.French: Yes, buy the orb and have it added to our library so researchers can benefit from its knowledge.
TEXT.German: Ja, kauft die Kugel und lasst sie in unsere Bibliothek bringen, damit die Gelehrten ihr Wissen nutzen können.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, buy the orb and have it added to our library so researchers can benefit from its knowledge.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, buy the orb and have it added to our library so researchers can benefit from its knowledge.

TEXT.English: Yes, buy the orb and have it destroyed so the spirit can pass into the afterlife.
TEXT.French: Yes, buy the orb and have it destroyed so the spirit can pass into the afterlife.
TEXT.German: Ja, kauft die Kugel und lasst sie zerstören, damit die Geister ins Jenseits übergehen können.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, buy the orb and have it destroyed so the spirit can pass into the afterlife.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, buy the orb and have it destroyed so the spirit can pass into the afterlife.

TEXT.English: After the orb is destroyed the ghost of a Patrian sage rises up before you. "Thank you for freeing me, please accept this gift in exchange for your kindness."
TEXT.French: After the orb is destroyed the ghost of a Patrian sage rises up before you. "Thank you for freeing me, please accept this gift in exchange for your kindness."
TEXT.German: Nachdem die Kugel zerstört ist, erscheint der Geist des patrianischen Gelehrten vor Euch. "Danke, dass Ihr mich befreit habt. Bitte nehmt dieses Geschenk als Belohnung für Eure Güte an."
TEXT.Italian: After the orb is destroyed the ghost of a Patrian sage rises up before you. "Thank you for freeing me, please accept this gift in exchange for your kindness."
TEXT.Spanish: After the orb is destroyed the ghost of a Patrian sage rises up before you. "Thank you for freeing me, please accept this gift in exchange for your kindness."

TEXT.English: A citizen in %s2_city has struck a huge jackpot while gaming in the gambling houses. The gambling house is unable to finance his winnings.
TEXT.French: Un citoyen de %s2_city a gagné le jackpot en jouant dans la maison de jeu.Celle-ci est incapable de financer ses gains.
TEXT.German: Ein Bürger in der Stadt %s2_city hat im Glücksspielhaus das große Los gezogen. Sein Gewinn ist so riesig, dass das Glücksspielhaus ihn nicht auszahlen kann.
TEXT.Italian: A citizen in %s2_city has struck a huge jackpot while gaming in the gambling houses. The gambling house is unable to finance his winnings.
TEXT.Spanish: Un ciudadano en %s2_city ha ganado un gran jackpot mientras jugaba en las casas de apuestas. La casa de apuestas es incapaz de satisfacer la cantidad de sus ganancias.

TEXT.English: The man was obviously cheating, have him punished.
TEXT.French: L'homme trichait certainement , punissez-le.
TEXT.German: Der Kerl hat ganz offensichtlich betrogen. Bestraft ihn dafür.
TEXT.Italian: The man was obviously cheating, have him punished.
TEXT.Spanish: Obviamente el hombre es un timador, haced que sea castigado.

TEXT.English: We cannot afford to pay him, dissolve all the gambling house's assets and give them to the winner.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons nous permettre de le payer, vendez les biens de la Maison de Jeu et donnez-les au gagnant.
TEXT.German: Wir können uns die Auszahlung nicht leisten. Verkauft das Glücksspielhaus und gebt den Erlös an den Gewinner.
TEXT.Italian: We cannot afford to pay him, dissolve all the gambling house's assets and give them to the winner.
TEXT.Spanish: No nos podemos permitir pagarle, disolved todos los bienes de las casas de apuestas y dádselos al ganador.

TEXT.English: Pay his winnings out of the empire's treasury.
TEXT.French: Payez ses gains avec le trésor impérial.
TEXT.German: Bezahlt seinen Gewinn aus dem Staatssäckel.
TEXT.Italian: Pay his winnings out of the empire's treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: Pagad sus ganancias del tesoro del imperio.

TEXT.English: Dip into the temple treasury to pay his winnings.
TEXT.French: prenez le trésor du temple pour payer ses gains. (requiert les Runes de Kilmorph comme religion d'état)
TEXT.German: Schöpft aus dem Schatz des Tempels um ihn auszuzahlen. ([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]erforderlich: Runen von Kilmorph als Staatsreligion [ICON_RELIGION][COLOR_REVERT])
TEXT.Italian: Dip into the temple treasury to pay his winnings.
TEXT.Spanish: Entrad en el tesoro del templo para pagar sus ganancias.

TEXT.English: A Khazad smith offers his services in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Un Forgeron Khazad offre ses services dans la ville de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Ein Schmied der Khazad bietet in der Stadt %s2_city seine Dienste an.
TEXT.Italian: A Khazad smith offers his services in the city of %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: Un herrero Khazad ofrece sus servicios en la ciudad de %s2_city.

TEXT.English: Allow him to setup a forge in the city.
TEXT.French: Autorisez-le à installer une forge dans la ville.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt ihm, eine Schmiede in der Stadt zu errichten.
TEXT.Italian: Allow him to setup a forge in the city.
TEXT.Spanish: Permitidle levantar una forja en la ciudad.

TEXT.English: Allow him to work in our forge.
TEXT.French: Autorisez-le à travailler dans notre forge.
TEXT.German: Erlaubt ihm, in unserer Schmiede zu arbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: Allow him to work in our forge.
TEXT.Spanish: Permitidle trabajar en nuestra forja.

TEXT.English: We have no need of his services.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas besoin de ses services.
TEXT.German: Nehmt ihn in die Schmiedegilde auf.
TEXT.Italian: We have no need of his services.
TEXT.Spanish: No necesitamos de sus servicios.

TEXT.English: The corridors beneath Letum Frigus are abandoned. Your troops imagine the sounds of the battle between Kylorin and Mulcarn still echo through the halls and examine the gouges and hollow chambers for evidence of the conflict. A scarred fissure may have been the blast of a god, the shards of a massive stalagmite may have been an errant strike of the Godslayer. Despite the legend of the site your troops don't discover anything of value.
TEXT.French: The corridors beneath Letum Frigus are abandoned. Your troops imagine the sounds of the battle between Kylorin and Mulcarn still echo through the halls and examine the gouges and hollow chambers for evidence of the conflict. A scarred fissure may have been the blast of a god, the shards of a massive stalagmite may have been an errant strike of the Godslayer. Despite the legend of the site your troops don't discover anything of value.
TEXT.German: Die Gänge unter Letum Frigus sind verlassen. Eure Truppen bilden sich ein, dass die Geräusche der Schlacht zwischen Kylorin und Mulcarn immer noch durch die Säle hallen, und suchen in den Gängen und leeren Kammern nach Spuren des Kampfes. Ein zerklüfteter Riss könnten vom Schlag eines Gottes herrühren, die Splitter eines massiven Stalagmiten von einem fehlgeleiteten Streiche des Gottesschlächters. Trotz der Legenden, die diese Stätte umranken, finden Eure Truppen nichts wertvolles.
TEXT.Italian: The corridors beneath Letum Frigus are abandoned. Your troops imagine the sounds of the battle between Kylorin and Mulcarn still echo through the halls and examine the gouges and hollow chambers for evidence of the conflict. A scarred fissure may have been the blast of a god, the shards of a massive stalagmite may have been an errant strike of the Godslayer. Despite the legend of the site your troops don't discover anything of value.
TEXT.Spanish: The corridors beneath Letum Frigus are abandoned. Your troops imagine the sounds of the battle between Kylorin and Mulcarn still echo through the halls and examine the gouges and hollow chambers for evidence of the conflict. A scarred fissure may have been the blast of a god, the shards of a massive stalagmite may have been an errant strike of the Godslayer. Despite the legend of the site your troops don't discover anything of value.

TEXT.English: There is nothing we can do here.
TEXT.French: There is nothing we can do here.
TEXT.German: Wir können hier leider nichts mehr tun.
TEXT.Italian: There is nothing we can do here.
TEXT.Spanish: There is nothing we can do here.

TEXT.English: We walk in the footsteps of Kylorin, spread the legend to our people.
TEXT.French: We walk in the footsteps of Kylorin, spread the legend to our people.
TEXT.German: Wir wandeln in den Fußstapfen von Kylorin. Verbreitet die Legende unter unserem Volk.
TEXT.Italian: We walk in the footsteps of Kylorin, spread the legend to our people.
TEXT.Spanish: We walk in the footsteps of Kylorin, spread the legend to our people.

TEXT.English: Our time is short, the legacy of Mulcarn will strengthen our resolve.
TEXT.French: Our time is short, the legacy of Mulcarn will strengthen our resolve.
TEXT.German: Die Zeit ist knapp. Das Vermächtnis von Mulcarn wird unsere Entschlossenheit stärken.
TEXT.Italian: Our time is short, the legacy of Mulcarn will strengthen our resolve.
TEXT.Spanish: Our time is short, the legacy of Mulcarn will strengthen our resolve.

TEXT.English: [ICON_BULLET]Gain the Aggressive trait
TEXT.French: [ICON_BULLET]Gain the Aggressive trait
TEXT.German: [ICON_BULLET]verleiht einem Oberhaupt die Eigenschaft "Aggressiv"
TEXT.Italian: [ICON_BULLET]Gain the Aggressive trait
TEXT.Spanish: [ICON_BULLET]Gain the Aggressive trait

TEXT.English: The library in %s2_city is on fire.
TEXT.French: The library in %s2_city is on fire.
TEXT.German: Die Bibliothek der Stadt %s2_city steht in Flammen.
TEXT.Italian: The library in %s2_city is on fire.
TEXT.Spanish: The library in %s2_city is on fire.

TEXT.English: Build fireblocks to keep it from spreading, there isn't anything we can do to save the library.
TEXT.French: Build fireblocks to keep it from spreading, there isn't anything we can do to save the library.
TEXT.German: Errichtet Brandschneisen, um die Ausbreitung des Feuers zu verhindern. Wir können nichts tun, um die Bibliothek zu retten.
TEXT.Italian: Build fireblocks to keep it from spreading, there isn't anything we can do to save the library.
TEXT.Spanish: Build fireblocks to keep it from spreading, there isn't anything we can do to save the library.

TEXT.English: Send an adept with proficiency in water magic to put out the fire.
TEXT.French: Send an adept with proficiency in water magic to put out the fire.
TEXT.German: Schickt einen Adepten, der die Wassermagie beherrscht, um das Feuer zu löschen.
TEXT.Italian: Send an adept with proficiency in water magic to put out the fire.
TEXT.Spanish: Send an adept with proficiency in water magic to put out the fire.

TEXT.English: A crazed, angry old man was recently detained at the temple of %s2_city. You hear numerous reports of him cursing at the priests for straying from the true religious path, shouting supposed prophecies of doom and gloom, and snarling in gibberish at the people attending services.
TEXT.French: A crazed, angry old man was recently detained at the temple of %s2_city. You hear numerous reports of him cursing at the priests for straying from the true religious path, shouting supposed prophecies of doom and gloom, and snarling in gibberish at the people attending services.
TEXT.German: Ein verrückter, wütender alter Mann wurde kürzlich in der Nähe des Tempels der Stadt %s2_city verhaftet. Ihr hört zahlreiche Berichte darüber, dass er die Priester beschimpft habe, vom wahrhaftigen Weg der Religion abgewichen zu sein. Er soll vermeintliche Prophezeiungen über das Jüngste Gericht und dunkle Mächte geschrieen und die Leute, die den Gottesdienst besuchten, während seines Geschnatters angeknurrt haben.
TEXT.Italian: A crazed, angry old man was recently detained at the temple of %s2_city. You hear numerous reports of him cursing at the priests for straying from the true religious path, shouting supposed prophecies of doom and gloom, and snarling in gibberish at the people attending services.
TEXT.Spanish: A crazed, angry old man was recently detained at the temple of %s2_city. You hear numerous reports of him cursing at the priests for straying from the true religious path, shouting supposed prophecies of doom and gloom, and snarling in gibberish at the people attending services.

TEXT.English: Exile him from our borders. We don't need him scaring our faithful.
TEXT.French: Exile him from our borders. We don't need him scaring our faithful.
TEXT.German: Verbannt ihn aus unseren Grenzen. Er soll unsere Gläubigen nicht mehr verängstigen.
TEXT.Italian: Exile him from our borders. We don't need him scaring our faithful.
TEXT.Spanish: Exile him from our borders. We don't need him scaring our faithful.

TEXT.English: His passion will be rewarded, drown him in the temple pools.
TEXT.French: His passion will be rewarded, drown him in the temple pools.
TEXT.German: Seine Leidenschaft soll belohnt werden. Ertränkt ihn in den Becken des Tempels.
TEXT.Italian: His passion will be rewarded, drown him in the temple pools.
TEXT.Spanish: His passion will be rewarded, drown him in the temple pools.

TEXT.English: Make him a priest and allow him to share his crazed stories with the populace.
TEXT.French: Make him a priest and allow him to share his crazed stories with the populace.
TEXT.German: Ernennt ihn zum Priester und erlaubt ihm, seine verrückten Geschichten mit der Öffentlichkeit zu teilen.
TEXT.Italian: Make him a priest and allow him to share his crazed stories with the populace.
TEXT.Spanish: Make him a priest and allow him to share his crazed stories with the populace.

TEXT.English: All voices must be heard, give him the robes of a disciple.
TEXT.French: All voices must be heard, give him the robes of a disciple.
TEXT.German: Alle Stimmen müssen gehört werden. Gebt ihm die Robe eines Geweihten.
TEXT.Italian: All voices must be heard, give him the robes of a disciple.
TEXT.Spanish: All voices must be heard, give him the robes of a disciple.

TEXT.English: Have him arrested and turn his possessions over to the state.
TEXT.French: Have him arrested and turn his possessions over to the state.
TEXT.German: Werft ihn in den Kerker und vermacht seine Besitztümer dem Staat.
TEXT.Italian: Have him arrested and turn his possessions over to the state.
TEXT.Spanish: Have him arrested and turn his possessions over to the state.

TEXT.English: Grant the man a seat on the city council.
TEXT.French: Grant the man a seat on the city council.
TEXT.German: Gewährt dem Mann einen Sitz im Stadtrat.
TEXT.Italian: Grant the man a seat on the city council.
TEXT.Spanish: Grant the man a seat on the city council.

TEXT.English: Gravediggers in %s2_city have come across an ancient cache of machine parts. They appear to be the parts to build a mechanized man. What would you like done with them?
TEXT.French: Gravediggers in %s2_city have come across an ancient cache of machine parts. They appear to be the parts to build a mechanized man. What would you like done with them?
TEXT.German: Totengräber in der Stadt %s2_city sind auf ein geheimes Lager antiker Maschinenteile gestoßen. Es scheinen Teile eines Maschinenmannes zu sein. Was wünscht Ihr mit ihnen zu tun?
TEXT.Italian: Gravediggers in %s2_city have come across an ancient cache of machine parts. They appear to be the parts to build a mechanized man. What would you like done with them?
TEXT.Spanish: Saqueadores de tumbas en %s2_city se han topado con un alijo antiguo de piezas de maquinaria. Parecen ser partes para construir un hombre mecanizado. ¿Que querríais que hiciéramos con ellas?

TEXT.English: Assemble the parts back into a man, let's hope it's friendly.
TEXT.French: Assemble the parts back into a man, let's hope it's friendly.
TEXT.German: Baut die Teile wieder zusammen. Lasst uns hoffen, dass es freundlich gesinnt ist.
TEXT.Italian: Assemble the parts back into a man, let's hope it's friendly.
TEXT.Spanish: Ensamblad las partes, esperemos que sea amigable.

TEXT.English: Assemble the parts correctly.
TEXT.French: Assemble the parts correctly.
TEXT.German: Baut die Teile korrekt zusammen.
TEXT.Italian: Assemble the parts correctly.
TEXT.Spanish: Assemble the parts correctly.

TEXT.English: Give the parts to our researchers to study.
TEXT.French: Give the parts to our researchers to study.
TEXT.German: Übergebt die Teile an unsere Wissenschaftler.
TEXT.Italian: Give the parts to our researchers to study.
TEXT.Spanish: Give the parts to our researchers to study.

TEXT.English: Sell the parts for gold.
TEXT.French: Sell the parts for gold.
TEXT.German: Verkauft die Teile gegen Gold.
TEXT.Italian: Sell the parts for gold.
TEXT.Spanish: Vended las partes a cambio de oro.

TEXT.English: Would you like to hire any units?
TEXT.French: Would you like to hire any units?
TEXT.German: Wärt Ihr daran interessiert, Einheiten anzuwerben?
TEXT.Italian: Would you like to hire any units?
TEXT.Spanish: Would you like to hire any units?

TEXT.English: Hire an Archer.
TEXT.French: Hire an Archer.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Bogenschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Hire an Archer.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire an Archer.

TEXT.English: Hire an Axeman.
TEXT.French: Hire an Axeman.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Axtkämpfer.
TEXT.Italian: Hire an Axeman.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire an Axeman.

TEXT.English: Hire a Catapult.
TEXT.French: Hire a Catapult.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet ein Katapult.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Catapult.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Catapult.

TEXT.English: Hire a Champion.
TEXT.French: Hire a Champion.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Champion.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Champion.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Champion.

TEXT.English: Hire a Horse Archer.
TEXT.French: Hire a Horse Archer.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Berittenen Bogenschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Horse Archer.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Horse Archer.

TEXT.English: Hire a Horseman.
TEXT.French: Hire a Horseman.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Reiter.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Horseman.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Horseman.

TEXT.English: Hire a Longbowman.
TEXT.French: Hire a Longbowman.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Langbogenschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Longbowman.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Longbowman.

TEXT.English: Hire a Mercenary.
TEXT.French: Hire a Mercenary.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet einen Söldner.
TEXT.Italian: Hire a Mercenary.
TEXT.Spanish: Hire a Mercenary.

TEXT.English: No.
TEXT.French: No.
TEXT.German: Nein.
TEXT.Italian: No.
TEXT.Spanish: No.

TEXT.English: The Malakim have invited your unit on a pilgrimage to their capital.
TEXT.French: Les Malakims ont invité votre unité à un pèlerinage vers leur capitale.
TEXT.German: Die Malakim haben Eure Einheit zu einer Pilgerreise in ihre Hauptstadt eingeladen.
TEXT.Italian: The Malakim have invited your unit on a pilgrimage to their capital.
TEXT.Spanish: Los Malakim han invitado a vuestra unidad a un peregrinaje hacia su capital.

TEXT.English: Send him, many return from these pilgrimages with divine guidance.
TEXT.French: Envoyez-le , beaucoup reviennent de ces pélerinages guidés par les dieux.
TEXT.German: Auf, auf! Vielen wird auf diesen Pilgerreisen göttliche Gnade zuteil.
TEXT.Italian: Send him, many return from these pilgrimages with divine guidance.
TEXT.Spanish: Enviadlo, que vuelva de ese peregrinaje con guía divina.

TEXT.English: We cannot afford the distraction.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons nous permettre cette distraction.
TEXT.German: Wir können uns diese Ablenkung nicht leisten.
TEXT.Italian: We cannot afford the distraction.
TEXT.Spanish: No nos podemos permitir esa distracción.

TEXT.English: Pickpockets have been plaguing the markets in %s2_city. Many people fear shopping in them and the watch captain complains that he needs to hire additional guards.
TEXT.French: Les pickpockets ont investi le marché de %s2_city. De nombreux citoyens ont peur d'aller y faire leurs courses et le capitaine de la garde se plaint qu'il a besoin d'engager plus de gardes.
TEXT.German: Diebe und Halsabschneider haben den Markt in der Stadt %s2_city heimgesucht. Viele Bürger fürchten sich nun davor, dort weiter einzukaufen, und der Wachhauptmann beschwert sich, er bräuchte mehr Wachen.
